**Simplified Text:**

A while ago, a website talked about the dangers of telling people where you are online. When you say, "I am here," you are also showing everyone where you are. Some people might not be nice. This shows that sharing everything online can have problems. 

The internet gives us many chances to share our lives. We can share our stories and photos. But sometimes, we can lose control and feel lost. This can be sad, but we should not give up. There are people who have gone through this before us. 

In January 1994, a 19-year-old student named Justin Hall started sharing his life on the internet. At that time, the web was mostly for students and scientists. Hall wanted to share his life, so he created a blog. Many people liked to read about his adventures. He wrote about everything, and anyone could be part of his stories. 

One day, people saw that his blog was gone. Instead, there was a sad video called Dark Night. Hall had fallen in love, but when he wrote about it, he was told to stop or lose his relationship. He felt that sharing his life online made people not trust him. 

In 2002, a woman named Heather Armstrong had a blog called Dooce. She wrote about her job. One day, someone at her work shared her blog with her bosses, and she lost her job. This shows that what we say online can have real-life effects. 

Armstrong was sad but later got married and started her blog again, focusing on her family. Now, she is very popular and makes money from her writing. She learned that we can say anything online, but we should be careful about what we share. 

**Questions:**

1. What did the website talk about?
2. Who is Justin Hall?
3. What happened to Justin Hall's blog?
4. What did Heather Armstrong write about?
5. What did Heather Armstrong learn from her experience?

**Simplified Text:**

Some scientists wanted to tell people about a movie called *What the Bleep Do We Know?* This movie mixes real facts and stories. It shows that there is a lot we do not understand about our universe. Some scientists did not like the movie. They called it “atrocious” and “dangerous.” 

At first, I did not understand why the movie was important. Some scientists talked about new discoveries. They said the universe is stranger than we thought. Then, the movie talked about how water can change because of our thoughts. I heard that a researcher in Japan showed that water can look different based on how people feel. The movie showed nice pictures of ice crystals that looked good when people were happy and looked bad when people were sad. 

Many people like these pictures. They think they are interesting. But scientists want more proof. They want real evidence, not just pretty pictures. The movie’s ideas were not strange enough. 

Real science shows that water and the universe are very complex. Scientists have found new things. They say the universe has a type of matter we do not know about and a force called “dark energy.” 

Scientists also found that our brains take time to understand what happens around us. They believe they know where modern humans came from and how they spread around the world. Some scientists think there is a link between life on Earth and the design of the universe. 

Science is always changing. We are learning more and more. There are many things we still do not understand. Some scientists are trying to find a “Theory of Everything” to explain all the forces and particles in the universe. But many people think the universe is amazing and incredible. 

**Questions:**

1. What is the name of the movie that some scientists talked about?
2. What did some scientists think about the movie?
3. What did the movie say about water?
4. What do scientists want instead of pretty pictures?
5. What is one thing scientists have discovered about the universe?

Text: "I find writing novels hard, but writing short stories is fun. Writing a novel is like planting a big forest. Writing a short story is like planting a small garden. Both are important to me. In the forest, there are tall trees and green leaves. The wind moves the leaves, and they can be bright gold. In the garden, flowers bloom, and colorful petals attract bees and butterflies. 

Since I started writing, I have written both novels and short stories. When I finish a novel, I want to write short stories. When I finish short stories, I want to write a novel. I do not write short stories when I write a novel, and I do not write a novel when I write short stories. 

I began my career with two short novels in 1975. From 1984 to 1985, I started writing short stories. I did not know much about writing short stories then, but it was a good experience. One of my first stories, 'Breaking Waves', was in my first collection called Tales from Abroad. 

One good thing about short stories is that they do not take long to finish. It usually takes me about a week to write a short story. Writing a novel takes a long time, sometimes a year or two. Writing a novel can feel very long, and I sometimes wonder if I can finish it. So, writing short stories is a nice change for me. 

Another nice thing about short stories is that you can create a story from small ideas, like a word or an image. It is like playing jazz music, where the story goes where it wants. You do not have to worry about failing. If an idea does not work, you can just move on. Even famous writers like F. Scott Fitzgerald and Raymond Carver did not write perfect stories every time. This makes me feel better. 

I learn from my mistakes in short stories and use that to help me write novels. Short stories help me try new things. They are like small memories I have shared with my readers. I remember each one and how I felt when I wrote it. Short stories are special to me, and I am happy to share my feelings with my readers."

**Simplified Text:**

Science is important. It helps us understand the world and can cure diseases. Science makes our lives easier, but it can also create problems. Scientists study many things, like tiny atoms and the universe. They try to explain how everything works.

Sometimes, scientists disagree. They have different ideas about how things are. New ideas can change what we believe. For example, a long time ago, people thought the universe was like a big clock. Now, scientists know it is much more complicated.

Famous scientists like Isaac Newton and Albert Einstein helped us learn a lot. They found new things, like radioactivity and atoms. Science is always changing, and there is still much to discover.

Science is not just for scientists. Everyone should understand it because it affects our lives. What scientists learn can change our future, like how we live and how healthy we are. It is important for everyone to pay attention to science.

**Simplified Text:**

Since about 2015, big book companies have said that sales of ebooks are not growing as much. Some companies even lost money because they thought ebooks would be very popular. People still ask if ebooks will replace printed books. This question makes us think and talk a lot. Why do we think ebooks and printed books are in a fight? The answer is not just about ebooks; it shows how we feel about new things and changes.

In my research, I found that people often think one type of media will end another when new technology comes out. For example, when television was invented, many people thought radio would stop. But radio found new ways to be used, like in cars and factories. The idea that books will disappear is not new. In 1894, some people thought that phonographs would replace books with audiobooks. This has happened many times with movies, radio, and smartphones. Some people worried that if books disappeared, culture would get worse. Others thought ebooks would be much better.

When new technology comes, we feel a mix of hope and fear. We get attached to things like books and TVs because they are important in our lives. Studies show that we can even name our cars or get upset with our computers. So, when something new, like e-readers, comes out, we have to change how we feel about things we love. This is why people still want old things. For example, when the printing press was made in Europe, people wanted to find old books. When movies changed from silent to sound, people missed the old silent films. The same thing happened with photography and music.

E-readers made people appreciate printed books more, even their smell. This should make people feel better about printed books not disappearing. But the idea that books might go away will still be a popular story. This story shows both our excitement for new things and our fear of losing what we love. We often tell stories about endings to help us understand changes. The story of the death of the book is easy to remember and share. It shows our hope for the future and our fear of losing parts of our lives.

Text: 

Every weekday morning for a year and a half, I woke up at 5:30. I brushed my teeth, made coffee, and wrote about how great thinkers from the last four hundred years worked. I wanted to show how they found time to be creative and productive. I wrote about their daily lives – when they slept, ate, and worked. I hoped to show their personalities and habits.

There is a saying: “Tell me what you eat, and I will tell you what you are.” I say, “Tell me what time you eat, and if you take a nap.” This book is about how people work, not just what they create. It is also personal. I think about how to do creative work while making money. Is it better to work on one project or do a little each day? When there is not enough time, do you give up sleep or a clean house, or can you learn to do more in less time?

I do not have all the answers, but I want to show how many successful people faced the same problems. I wanted to show how big ideas become small daily actions and how habits affect work. The book is called Daily Rituals, but it is really about people’s routines. A routine can help you use your time well. Good habits can help you focus and be more productive.

The psychologist William James said that good habits can help us think about important things. He was a procrastinator and could not keep a regular schedule. Ironically, my own procrastination helped me create this book. One Sunday, I was at my job, trying to write a story. Instead of working, I cleaned my desk and made coffee. I am a morning person and work best in the morning. That afternoon, I started looking online for information about other writers’ schedules. I thought it would be good to collect these stories, so I started a blog called Daily Routines.

In the blog, I shared people’s routines from biographies and articles. For this book, I have gathered more information and made it better. I let the people I wrote about share their own words from letters and interviews. I also summarized some routines from other sources. This book would not be possible without the work of many biographers and journalists. I have listed all my sources in the Notes section for more reading.

**Simplified Text:**

Howard wanted to be a palaeontologist when he was six years old. One day, his father said they could not go on holiday to Spain because of money problems. Instead, they went to a beach in England. On the beach, Howard found a small fossil called an ammonite. He liked fossils and wanted to study them.

When Howard finished university, he wanted to find a job as a palaeontologist. He was not sure if he would get a job, but he believed he could do good work. He applied for a job at Tavistock College in London. On the day of his interview, the professor who was supposed to help him had a fight with his wife and got into an accident. He could not come to the interview.

Another professor, who did not like the first professor, was there instead. This professor helped Howard get the job. Howard was surprised but happy to have the job. He could now do the work he loved.

One day, Howard's briefcase with his lecture notes was stolen at a train station. He was very upset. He went back to the college, called to postpone his lecture, and reported the theft. After that, he had coffee with a colleague who was visiting from the Natural History Museum in Nairobi. 

During their talk, Howard learned about new fossils that needed to be studied. This was a big opportunity for him. Because of the theft, he changed his plans. He decided not to go to a conference in Stockholm and not to take students to Scotland. Instead, he would find money to visit the museum in Nairobi. 

**Questions:**

1. What did Howard find on the beach?
2. Where did Howard apply for a job?
3. What happened to the professor on the day of Howard's interview?
4. How did Howard feel when he got the job?
5. What was stolen from Howard at the train station?
6. What did Howard decide to do after his briefcase was stolen?

Text: 

Charles Spence likes to eat many different foods. He is a professor at Oxford University in the UK. He has ice cream made from bee larvae at home. It looks strange, but it tastes a little like nuts and flowers. Spence and his team study how our senses help us taste food. They want to make eating bugs more normal. 

Spence helps big food companies and restaurants with their food. He studies how we enjoy food. For example, who we eat with, how food looks, and even the sounds around us can change how we taste food. In his book, The Perfect Meal, he shares interesting facts about eating. Did you know that the first person to order food in a restaurant usually enjoys their meal more? And when we eat with one other person, we eat about 35% more food. If we eat with three people, we eat 75% more!

Spence's lab in Oxford is simple. He uses old equipment and has quiet rooms for testing. He works with cooks who do not have a lot of money for research. Many of his projects are funded by big food companies. Some people think that research with companies is not real science, but now it is important for universities to show their work helps people.

Spence helps food brands reduce salt and sugar in their products. This is good for customers because it helps them stay healthy. Many companies do this slowly so that people do not notice the change. Spence says that if people know about the changes, they may not like the food as much.

Spence met a famous chef named Heston Blumenthal while working on a food project. They worked together to create a dish called "Sound of the Sea." Spence studies how sounds can change the taste of food. For example, high sounds can make food taste sweet, and low sounds can make it taste bitter. Soon, an airline will play music that matches the food they serve.

Spence has fun dinner parties at home. One time, they ate rabbit with the fur on the cutlery. Another time, they used colorful lights and headphones to see how they changed the taste of drinks. For Spence, home and food events are just like his lab.

**Simplified Text:**

Our brains are very busy today. We get a lot of information, like facts, rumors, and chatter. We need to find what is important and what we can ignore. We are also doing more things ourselves. Thirty years ago, travel agents helped us book flights, and salespeople helped us in stores. Now, we do these things by ourselves. We are trying to do many tasks at the same time, like taking care of our families, jobs, hobbies, and watching TV. Our smartphones help us with this. 

But there is a problem. We think we can do many things at once, but this is not true. Earl Miller, a scientist, says our brains are not good at multitasking. When we try to do many things, we switch quickly from one task to another. This is not efficient. Multitasking can make us feel stressed and confused. 

When we try to focus on one task but see an email, it can make it harder to think clearly. Glenn Wilson, a psychology professor, found that trying to focus while seeing emails can lower our IQ. It is even worse than being tired. 

When we learn new things while multitasking, the information goes to the wrong part of our brain. For example, if students do homework and watch TV, they do not remember the information well. Without distractions, they can remember better. 

Making decisions while multitasking is also hard for our brains. Small decisions can take as much energy as big ones. After many small decisions, we can make bad choices about important things. 

Many people talk about email as a problem. It is not about email itself, but the large number of emails we get. We feel we must reply to them, but it is hard to do that and finish other tasks. 

**Questions:**

1. What do our brains get a lot of today?
2. Who helped people book flights thirty years ago?
3. What do we use to help us with many tasks?
4. What does Earl Miller say about multitasking?
5. What happens to our IQ when we try to focus on tasks and see emails?
6. Where does new information go when we multitask?
7. Why is making decisions while multitasking hard for our brains?
8. What is the problem with email according to many people?

**Simplified Text:**

In a zoo in Sweden, a chimpanzee named Santino broke concrete at night. He threw the pieces at visitors during the day. Was he being mean? In caves in the US, female bats help other bats that are not their babies if they need help. Are they being kind? Fifty years ago, people did not think much about these questions. They believed animals just acted in ways that could be measured. They thought animals did not have feelings or thoughts like humans. 

But now, this idea is changing. Research on bats, chimps, rats, dolphins, and chickens shows that animals have feelings. This has led to new books about animal emotions, like Mark Bekoff’s "Wild Justice" and Victoria Braithwaite’s "Do Fish Feel Pain?". This has started a big question: Do animals have thoughts and feelings like humans? 

There is another question about conscience, which is a person’s sense of right and wrong. In a recent study with cows, cows that opened a locked gate for food seemed happier than cows that had help. If cows enjoy solving problems, what does this mean for eating beef? People agree on what they see, but they do not agree on what it means. 

Dr. Jonathan Balcombe, who wrote "Second Nature," believes we should stop eating meat. He thinks this is a big change in how we think about ethics. Aubrey Manning, a professor, thinks we should think more about how animals think. He believes animals have a simpler way of thinking than humans. Professor Euan MacPhail thinks we should not put human feelings on animals. 

These ideas may never agree because the main issue is not just science or morals, but philosophy. It is hard to define what consciousness is. Can we ever know what it is like to be a bat? Balcombe did a study that suggests starlings, a type of bird, can feel sad. In his study, some starlings lived in nice cages, and some lived in small, bad cages. Both groups learned to eat tasty worms. But when only bad worms were given, only the starlings in nice cages would eat. Balcombe thinks that living in a bad cage made the starlings feel negative about life.

Balcombe has worked with animal rights groups. He believes that in the future, people will look back and think it is wrong to treat animals badly, just like we think it is wrong to be racist. He says we cannot support animal rights while eating meat. 

If Balcombe were the only one with this idea, it might be easy to ignore him. But Professor Aubrey Manning agrees with him. Manning has written a book about animal behavior. He says we are changing how we think about animals. In the past, some people thought animals thought like humans, but now we are starting to think differently. This is a complicated topic, and it is important to listen to different opinions.

**Simplified Text:**

Critical thinking is how we think about what we read or hear to understand it better. Adrian West, a researcher, says that arguing can help us find the truth. Technology helps us store and process information, but it can also make it hard to think deeply about problems. West says we see a lot of poor thinking and opinions that can confuse us. More information does not always mean we know more or make better choices. 

Reading books has gone down a lot, and this may hurt our critical thinking skills. Patricia Greenfield, a professor, believes that focusing more on videos and images can be a problem. People often do many things at once instead of focusing on one thing. We do not yet know exactly how technology affects our thinking. 

Technology can be both good and bad. For example, a computer game can help us think better or make it harder to think deeply. Reading online can help us analyze information, but clicking many links can distract us. Greenfield says that reading helps us think and use our imagination better than watching videos or playing games. However, some visual media can help us process information quickly. 

Many young people may not reach their full potential because they do not spend enough time thinking deeply. How we see technology affects how we think critically. James Paul Gee, a professor, says that people often think video games are bad for kids. But he believes they can be good for learning. Some games, like Sim City and Civilization, help kids learn to make decisions and think critically. These games let players explore ideas that they might not be able to in real life. 

In today’s world, as reading and math scores go down, we need to understand how technology affects our thinking. 

**Questions:**

1. What is critical thinking?
2. Who is Adrian West?
3. What does Patricia Greenfield think about visual media?
4. How can video games help children?
5. Why is it important to understand technology and thinking?

**Simplified Text:**

Matthew Crawford is a motorcycle mechanic. He used to work in an office but did not like it. He writes about how we should live. His first book is about the good things in manual work. His latest book talks about how to deal with modern life. 

One day, while shopping, he saw ads on a credit card machine while he was entering his pin number. He thought that it is hard to avoid these ads. We often cannot choose what to think about because of these distractions. It is harder to think and remember conversations. People do not want to talk to strangers anymore because they are tired of being interrupted.

Crawford says we see the world through things like video games and phone apps. These things show us what we want, but they can take over our lives. Many office workers complain about emails but still check them in their free time. Studies show that just seeing a phone can make it hard to pay attention. 

Crawford believes that technology makes us focus too much on ourselves. We have many choices, and this makes it hard to control ourselves. We often prefer to text friends instead of talking to them. He thinks that by only using screens, we might lose important connections with other people.

He gives an example of his gym. Before, there was one music player for everyone. Now, people listen to their own music with ear buds. The gym used to be a place to meet others, but now it is not. Real connections often happen when people have different opinions and work things out.

Crawford has two ideas to help. First, we need to reduce noise and distractions in public places. Second, he thinks we should practice skills that help us connect with the real world. For example, cooks, ice-hockey players, and motorbike racers deal with real things. They use their judgment and work with others.

Crawford says that when we engage with the real world, we see that fake experiences are not as good. It is not necessary for everyone to become a chef, but it is important to use our judgment. Focusing on one thing can help us pay attention to other things too.

Text: 

"What do you do for work?" This is a common question. Many people answer it with a few words about their job. But if you are a philosopher, it can be a bit harder. Saying "I am a philosopher" can sound like you think you are better than others. This is not true. Philosophers are just like everyone else. 

Philosophers often think about life and how people live. A famous philosopher named Aristotle said that thinking about life is very important. He believed that a thoughtful life is the best life. Another philosopher, Socrates, said that a life without reflection is not worth living. This means that we should think about our lives and the choices we make.

You do not need to read many books or be very smart to think about your life. It just means looking closely at your daily experiences. This can help you understand what is important to you. 

However, many philosophers work in universities and do not talk to regular people. This can make philosophy seem far away from real life. Philosophers often write for other experts, and this can make their ideas hard to understand. 

I sometimes call myself an "ethicist" because I study ethics, which is about what is right and wrong. Ethics is important because it helps us think about our actions. For example, we can ask if downloading movies without paying is wrong. 

Philosophy helps us think about our lives and our beliefs. Sometimes we find out that we already know something, and other times we learn new things. By thinking about these ideas, we can help ourselves and others.

**Simplified Text:**

Many people love food. They think about what we eat and how we eat. This can make eating more enjoyable. In the past, when philosophers talked about food, they often used it to explain other ideas, like learning. Sometimes, they seemed to talk about food, but they were really discussing other topics.

One famous philosopher, Epicurus, said we should enjoy life and avoid pain. He talked about many things, but people now often think of him as someone who loved good food and drink. His name is used for restaurants and food shops because they want people to think their food is good.

Food is important in our lives. It comes from our history and is shared with our friends and family. We eat together, and this makes food special. We think about food more than other things we buy. After food is cooked, critics write and talk about it. Some people wonder why food critics are important. One philosopher said that they are good at describing how food tastes, not because they have special skills.

We often talk about art, like paintings or music, being beautiful, but we don’t usually say food is beautiful. Some philosophers believe that food should be talked about in the same way as art because it is important. However, food is eaten, and it does not last like art does.

There are also many questions about what we should eat. Should we eat organic food, free-range eggs, or vegetarian meals? Our choices show what we believe is right or wrong. Philosophers like to discuss these questions about food.

Cooking at home is different from cooking in a restaurant. When we cook at home, we share food with friends and family. But restaurant cooks work for their boss and have different rules. Their kitchens are not open to everyone.

A recent essay called "Diplomacy of the Dish" talks about how food can help people from different cultures understand each other. We can learn to enjoy other people's food and make friends by eating together. The essay has many interesting stories that make food philosophy fun to read about.

**Simplified Text:**

Rob Daviau is from the US. He makes special board games called ‘legacy’ games. When he was a child, he played board games, but he thought they were not fun or exciting anymore. He wanted to make board games better. He asked, “Can board games have a story? Can choices in one game affect the next game?” 

He changed a classic game called Risk and made a new version called Risk Legacy. In this game, choices made by players can change the game forever. Players might have to tear up cards or open new packets with new rules. The game is played over several sessions, and players can remember past events in the game. 

Rob also worked on a legacy version of a game called Pandemic. In Pandemic, players work together to cure diseases. His next game was called SeaFall. Pandemic Legacy was very popular, but SeaFall was a big test because it was a new game. In SeaFall, players are sailors exploring a new world.

Designers of legacy games must think about all the choices players can make. They need to test the games to see how they work. Jaime Barriga was a tester for SeaFall. He said it takes a lot of time to make the game right. Sometimes the game works well at first, but later it can break, and they have to fix it.

Rob did not think legacy games would be very popular. He thought only a few people would like them. But many players, like Russell Chapman, really enjoy them. He thinks legacy games are a big step forward in game design. Players like to learn new things in these games.

Another fan, Ben Hogg, said that even if players worry about changing the game, they still enjoy the adventure. He compared it to watching a new movie. Players want to have a fun experience, like in video games.

Rob Daviau wanted to tell stories in games. He used to want to be a TV writer. Matt Leacock, who made Pandemic, said making legacy games is like writing a book. You need to know how the story starts and ends, but you also need to plan the details.

Rob likes to see how others use his ideas, but he thinks players will soon want something new. Colby Dauch, who works for the company that made SeaFall, believes legacy games change how people think about board games. 

**Questions:**

1. Who is Rob Daviau?
2. What type of games does he design?
3. What is the name of the classic game he changed?
4. What do players do in Pandemic?
5. What is SeaFall about?
6. Why do designers test legacy games?
7. What did Jaime Barriga say about testing games?
8. Did Rob think legacy games would be popular?
9. What do players like about legacy games?
10. What did Matt Leacock compare making legacy games to?

**Simplified Text:**

One night, an octopus named Inky escaped from his tank at the National Aquarium in New Zealand. He crawled across the floor and went into a small drain that led to the Pacific Ocean. This story was fun and many people shared it online. 

People like to think that animals are like us. Octopuses are very smart. They can open jars, recognize faces, and even play. Some scientists believe that animals have feelings and can think about the past and future, just like humans. 

In the past, people thought animals were smart. For example, in medieval Europe, animals could be put on trial for crimes. Charles Darwin, a famous scientist, said that animals and humans are different, but only in degree, not kind. 

In the 20th century, many people thought animals were not very smart. They believed animals only acted because of rewards or punishments. This was a time when humans were harming animal homes and not caring for them. 

Now, scientists like Dr. Frans de Waal think we are starting to understand that animals are smarter than we thought. He says that animals have their own special skills. For example, squirrels can remember where they hide their nuts, which is something we might not be good at. 

Inky’s story is popular, but Dr. de Waal is not sure if Inky really knew how to escape to the ocean. He knows that stories about animals help people see how smart they can be. 

In one experiment, scientists found that capuchin monkeys can feel envy. When they saw other monkeys getting better food, they got very upset. A video of this experiment helped many people understand the findings better. 

**Questions:**

1. What is the name of the octopus in the story?
2. Where did Inky escape from?
3. What can octopuses do that shows they are smart?
4. Who is Charles Darwin?
5. What did scientists think about animals in the 20th century?
6. What special skill do squirrels have?
7. What did the capuchin monkeys feel when they saw other monkeys getting better food?

**Simplified Text:**

Robots are becoming very important in our world. They are not just in stories anymore; they are in factories and other places. Many people think that robots will do most of the work that humans do in the next 50 years. But many also believe their jobs will stay the same. This is not true. Robots will change many jobs soon.

For example, a company in Australia made a robot called Hadrian X. This robot can lay 1,000 bricks in one hour. It would take two human workers a whole day to do this. Another robot, Tally, helps in supermarkets. It checks if the shelves have enough products and if they are priced correctly.

Some people say that robots will create new jobs for skilled workers, like technicians. But others worry that we need to keep human skills in jobs. Dr. Jing Bing Zhang studies how robots will change work. He says that in two years, many robots will be smarter and work well with humans. In three years, many big companies will have a special person to manage robots.

Zhang also says that in five years, salaries in the robot field will go up a lot, but there will not be enough skilled workers for these jobs. He believes that people need to learn new skills to keep their jobs. 

New robots will also be made for homes. These robots will be able to talk and help us in new ways. This is a big chance for companies, but it also brings challenges. We need new rules to keep people safe and protect their privacy.

With many jobs at risk, it is important to learn about robots and technology. Countries need more students in science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM) to stay strong in the future. 

**Questions:**

1. What can the Hadrian X robot do?
2. What does the Tally robot do in supermarkets?
3. Who studies how robots will change work?
4. What do many people believe about their jobs in the future?
5. Why do countries need more students in STEM?

**Simplified Text:**

George Mallory was a climber. He was asked why he wanted to climb Mount Everest. He said, "Because it’s there." This means he wanted to climb just for the adventure. Many people wonder why anyone would want to climb mountains. Some climbers do it for fun and to face challenges.

A writer named Tejada-Flores wrote an essay in 1967 called "Games that Climbers Play." He talked about different types of climbing, from climbing small rocks to big mountains. Each type has its own rules. Many climbers love climbing because it makes them feel free. But sometimes, climbing can be hard and dangerous, like when a storm traps them in a tent.

Joe Fitschen, another climber, asked a different question: "Why do people climb?" He thinks climbing is part of being human. We like to take on challenges, even if they are risky. Brian Treanor, a teacher, wrote that climbing can help us learn important values like courage and respect for nature. 

Some expert climbers, Ebert and Robinson, said that climbing alone is harder and deserves more praise than climbing with a team or using special tools. But this idea can be dangerous for some climbers.

Climbing can also be a way to feel calm and focused. Many climbers talk about being in the moment or feeling peaceful while climbing. This is similar to some ideas in Zen philosophy, which helps people find peace of mind. 

So, there are many reasons why people like to climb mountains. 

**Questions:**

1. Who was George Mallory?

Text: 

Alfred Brendel is a famous pianist. He played classical music for many years. He was very smart and serious. He played many piano pieces and recorded them. He did not teach many students. People who knew him said he was sometimes funny, but he did not show this in his concerts. He worked hard and traveled a lot.

A few years ago, a young boy named Kit Armstrong came to one of Brendel’s concerts. He wanted piano lessons. At first, Brendel did not want to teach him. He had very few students before. But when he heard Kit play, he changed his mind. Kit was about 14 years old and played very well. Brendel thought Kit was special and decided to teach him.

Now, Kit is 19 years old. He is always busy. He learns new languages, studies math, writes computer code, and plays tennis. His mother is always with him. Kit also composes music. Brendel thinks it is important to learn to read music and to write music. He noticed that Kit has a great memory and can read music very well. Kit listens to Brendel and understands what he means.

Brendel is careful not to raise expectations for Kit. He does not want people to think Kit is perfect. Some newspapers say Kit is the best young pianist, but Brendel thinks this is not good. Kit can play some pieces very well, but he still needs time to learn others.

Now, at 80 years old, Brendel is happy in his life after performing. He says when he was young, he did not want to be famous quickly. He wanted to achieve certain things by the age of 50. When he was 50, he felt he had done many things, but he still wanted to do more. Now, he does not play as much, but he enjoys his new life.

Text: 

When I was a child, I thought gardens were beautiful places. My Grandad’s garden was by a river. It went down gently to the water. You could not touch the river, but you could hear the water and the birds in the trees. I thought all gardens were like this – a nice and quiet place. 

Grandad’s garden was simple. He did not have a big greenhouse like some of his neighbors. Their greenhouses were made from old windows. They used plastic to cover broken glass. 

At home, my father was quiet. He was not serious all the time. He liked to say funny things. He often said, “It’s immaterial to me,” instead of “I don’t mind.” He left school without finishing and became a plumber. He did not love plumbing. He was not very ambitious, but he thought about moving to Canada with my mother. They did not go. 

My father was good at fixing things at home. He could build bookshelves and cupboards very well. My parents moved to a new house only once. My mother liked to change the furniture a lot. Just when you got used to one chair, she would bring in another. The biggest change was when a piano came into the house. I wanted to like it, but it made me nervous. I liked the two brass candlesticks on it. My mother said they were too fancy, and they disappeared when I was at school. I never got to play the piano. My sister had lessons instead. When I asked my mother why, she said, “You’d never have practiced.”

I liked the river best of all places. I could imagine a different world there. I would take a fishing net and walk along the riverbank in my old sandals. I looked for a good spot to take off my sandals and find fish in the water. I tried to keep the fish at home, but they did not live long. 

I wanted to leave school quickly, but it seemed hard. One day, my father said, “There is a job for an apprentice gardener in the Parks Department. I thought you might like it.” He did not think I would be a gardener, but maybe he hoped I would be happy. I believe he saw how much I loved to garden, even if he did not like it himself.

Lawrence MacEwen is on his island, the Isle of Muck, in Scotland. I am with him. The wind is very strong, and it feels like we might be blown away. But Lawrence is not worried. He has a sheepdog named Tie. The wind is loud, but Lawrence is happy on his island.

Lawrence shows me his island. He points to another island called Eigg. He says the island next to it is Rum, and it rains a lot there. I see dark clouds over Rum. He also mentions another island called Soay. 

Suddenly, Lawrence says he needs to move his sheep. We walk down the hill. He tells me that the Isle of Muck is three kilometers long and one and a half kilometers wide. There are many geese here, and the MacEwen family has lived on this island for 3000 years. 

Lawrence calls Tie to help with the sheep, but Tie is not doing a good job. Lawrence is a little disappointed. The Isle of Muck is mostly run by the MacEwen family. Lawrence and his wife, Jenny, run the farm. Their son Colin takes care of the cottages, and their daughter Mary runs the hotel with her husband, Toby. Mary and Toby like that their two boys can play outside and sail in the summer. 

Life on the island is not always easy. There is electricity only sometimes. One evening, I wait for the lights to come on. The next morning, I see Mary making breakfast with a flashlight. There is also no mobile phone service. Mary tells me that some people go to the hill to use their phones, but most just put them away. 

Today, a boat brings groceries and three musicians. They come to play music in the tearoom, and everyone enjoys it. That night, Lawrence tells me how he met Jenny. Her father bought a farm on Soay without seeing it. Jenny had to manage it, but she did not know much about farms. She was good at typing.

I go to bed listening to the rain. I eat well because most of the food comes from the island. Mary sends me to get fresh fish from a fisherman named Sandy. I bring the fish back to Mary. By 7 pm, we eat the fish, and it is very tasty.

The next morning, I have to take a ferry to another island. Many ferries have been canceled because of the strong waves. If my ferry does not come, I will stay on Muck for two more days. I secretly hope that happens.

Text: "When I was a child, I wanted to play football. My dad helped me and encouraged me to play. I had a friend who played with us, but his dad was very strict. He always said, ‘You can’t do this, you can’t do that.’ My friend stopped wanting to play football because of this. I am happy that I still love football. When I score a great goal, some people say it is just luck, but I know it is because I practice a lot. The best players practice for many years. I learned how to play well, and I teach kids to enjoy learning. 

At school, I played many sports like rounders, baseball, athletics, and basketball. I know school is important, but I only thought about football then. I want my son to enjoy learning too. We read him books, even if he is too young to sit still. I hope he does not just want to kick the books around.

When I started my football career, my manager helped young players like me. He did not make a big deal about it, but we knew we had to do well. I scored in my first game, but we lost. A TV presenter said, ‘You can’t win anything with kids.’ This made us work harder. I trust my friends and family a lot. 

I have money, and I help my parents. I paid off their house and bought them a car. My mom loves her job as a hairdresser, and I want to help her. I have money, but it does not solve all my problems. After I stop playing football, I want to take a break and do things I could not do before. I want to go skiing, but I cannot do that now. If I get hurt, I cannot play football again."

We lived at Reef Point because of Sam Carter. Sam was my father’s agent in Los Angeles. He helped us find a cheap place to live. My father could not write in Los Angeles because he did not like it there. Sam was worried about losing money and clients.

In the summer, the beach was empty because of the sea fog. Few people came to Reef Point. The road was not nice, and a better place, La Carmella, was nearby. People with money went there. Only those who had no money or loved surfing came to Reef Point. But now, in the hot weather, many people were at the beach. 

My father was busy every day trying to write a script. I often went to the beach with my dog, Rusty. When we first moved to Reef Point, we did not have a dog. Rusty came to us and did not leave. I tried to send him away, but he always came back. One day, I gave him some water. My father did not like Rusty at first, but he did not really chase him away.

Rusty loved the beach. He liked to dig and bring things to me. Sometimes he found things that were not his, like a sneaker or a beach towel. I had to give these back to their owners. Rusty liked to swim with me, even though I could swim better and faster. 

One day, after swimming, my father went to Los Angeles to deliver his script. Rusty and I stayed at the beach. The sun was setting, and it was getting cooler. We watched the surfers. They were very good at surfing. One surfer was special. She was better than the others. 

She came to me and said, “Hi! Why didn’t you join us?” I replied, “I don’t have a surfboard.” She said, “You could get one.” I answered, “I have no money.” Then she asked, “You’re British, right? Are you visiting?” I said, “No, I live here.” She asked, “Is your father American?” I said, “No. He came here to write a film script from a book he wrote.” She was surprised and asked, “What’s his name?” I said, “Rufus Marsh.” She said, “Do you mean, Tall as the Morning?” I nodded. She smiled and said, “I read that book!” Now she was interested in me. I felt happy because people liked to talk when I mentioned the book.

Text: 

Violet Hetherington was in a long line at the dock in Southampton. She was waiting to get on a ship called the Queen Caroline. Her friend Annie had told her to arrive late so she would not wait too long. But now, Violet was worried. 

After some time, an announcement said there was a problem with the computer system. The people waiting became unhappy. They had paid a lot of money for this trip, and they wanted to get on the ship. Violet felt like she made a mistake coming on this cruise. 

She looked in her bag for her phone but could not find it. This made her more upset. She needed her phone to call the taxi company to see if she left it in the taxi. But she could not call because all her numbers were in her phone. 

Behind her, a nice couple was waiting. Violet asked them if she could use their phone to call her son Harry. She left a message for him to ask their neighbor, Kristina, if she could check for her phone. If it was not in her flat, she would have a problem because she needed to find numbers in New York. 

Finally, the line started to move, and Violet gave her travel documents to the worker. When she got inside the ship, it looked like a fancy hotel but not very nice. There were shiny things and big lights everywhere. 

Violet followed the signs to the elevators. The elevator was full of tired people with their bags. When the elevator stopped, everyone got out, and Violet finally reached her floor. 

She was happy to see that her room had a balcony, just like she wanted. She had worried about this, but now she felt relieved. She had paid a lot of money to make sure she had a nice view of the sea.

Text: 

John Maloof bought a box of old photo negatives at an auction. He wanted pictures for a book about Portage Park, a neighborhood in Chicago, USA. Instead, he found 30,000 photos by Vivian Maier, a street photographer. Maloof has collected many things from Maier's life, like her cameras, 2,000 rolls of film, 3,000 prints, and 100,000 negatives. He also has some movies and audiotapes.

One morning, Maloof looked at all the things he found. He felt lucky. He said, "When I bought this, I had no idea what it was." Maloof and his friend Anthony Rydzon are trying to learn more about Maier's life. They talked to families that knew her when she worked as a nanny and to people who developed her film.

Vivian Maier was born in 1926 in New York. She lived in France when she was a child. In 1951, she came back to New York and moved to Chicago in 1956 to work as a nanny. Maier was a private person but always had a camera. She wore big coats, wide hats, and strong shoes. Maren Baylaender, who knew her, said, "On her day off, she had her camera and we didn’t see her until late at night." Maier liked movies and had strong opinions about them.

Maier took pictures of women, children, old people, and the poor. Larry Silverman, a photography expert, said, "Vivian has many interesting pictures." He wonders if she learned from other photographers or if she had her own style. Maloof often thinks about all the negatives he has. He did not care much about photography until he found Maier's work. Now, he takes pictures too. He said, "I realized that the people and street scenes were more important than I thought." Maloof wants to share Vivian Maier's name and work with the world.

Text: 

When people talk in English, they often start with the weather. A famous writer, Dr. Johnson, said that when two English people meet, they first talk about the weather. This is still true today. Many people wonder why English people talk about the weather so much. Some think it is because they really like the weather. 

An American writer, Bill Bryson, says that English weather is not very interesting. He thinks that in other places, the weather is more exciting with storms and big changes. But a British broadcaster, Jeremy Paxman, disagrees. He believes that English weather is interesting because it is always changing. 

I think both Bryson and Paxman miss the real reason why English people talk about the weather. When they say things like, “Nice day, isn’t it?” or “Ooh, isn’t it cold?” they are not really asking about the weather. These phrases are ways to start a conversation or fill a pause. 

Talking about the weather is like a way for English people to connect with each other. There are three main times when they talk about the weather: as a greeting, to start a conversation, or when there is a quiet moment. This is why it seems like English people talk about the weather all the time. They might start with a weather greeting, then talk a little more about the weather, and go back to it if there is a pause. This makes it look like they are very interested in the weather.

2. Who said that English people first talk about the weather?

5. Why do English people use weather talk?

Alice Leader was standing in front of Hadrian’s Wall in Britain. She was with her class of 12- and 13-year-olds. She wanted to tell them how amazing it was that the Romans built a wall that is 120 km long and 5 meters high a long time ago. The students were excited about this trip. They chose it instead of going to Spain, Greece, or France. But they wanted to know why the wall was built. Alice felt she did not have good answers. 

Alice could not find a good book about the history of the wall, so she decided to write one herself. She stopped teaching after 31 years and became a writer in 2001. Alice felt nervous but excited about this new job. She said, “Teaching is like acting. Writing is exciting, but it is not so tiring.” 

Alice wants to write books for children that are different from many books today. She thinks many books for young people are sad or very fantasy, like Harry Potter. Alice wants her books to be real but also fun. 

Alice always taught English and History together. She loves to see when children go from being bored to being interested. She thinks it is her job to make learning fun. 

Alice started writing because her two sons were leaving home, and her head teacher suggested she take a writing course. At first, she did not want to go. But she had to send a story to the teachers before she could join the course. She quickly wrote a story about a Roman couple and their baby. After three hours, she had 30 pages and sent it in. She was accepted into the course. 

During the course, other students liked her story and told her to publish it. Alice asked her school head teacher for a year off to write her first book. Her husband, Zachary Leader, helps her with editing her work. He changes sentences and helps make the story better. Alice thinks they work well together.

Text: 

When you play on Centre Court at Wimbledon, it is very quiet. You bounce the ball on the soft grass. You throw it up to serve and hit it. You can hear your own shots. The grass is nice, and the stadium is old and special. The players wear white, and the crowd is respectful. This quiet helps me play better. 

In a tennis match, I try to focus only on the game. When I win a point, the crowd cheers and claps. I hear them, but it feels far away. I do not think about the many people watching me on TV. I am playing Roger Federer in the 2008 Wimbledon final. This is the biggest match of my life. I always wanted to play at Wimbledon. My uncle Toni, my coach, told me it is the most important tournament. When I was 14, I dreamed of playing there and winning.

Before 2008, I played and lost to Federer two times. In 2006, I was happy just to be there. Federer won easily. But in 2007, I was very sad. I knew I could have played better. I cried for half an hour after that match. Losing hurts, especially when you have a chance to win. Toni usually does not comfort me, but after 2007, he told me not to cry. He said there would be more chances to play at Wimbledon. I thought this was my last chance. I know that a professional athlete's career is short, and I want to make the most of it.

In 2008, I had another chance. I felt ready to win. The night before the final, I had dinner with my family and friends. We did not talk about the match because I was already thinking about it in my mind. I wanted to keep that space for myself until the match started.

Text: 

A young English woman named Jane Goodall came to Africa in April 1957. In her first letter home, she wrote, "I am living in the Africa I have always wanted." She spent most of her life in Africa. Jane was a citizen, journalist, scientist, activist, and environmentalist. 

In 1963, Jane became famous because of articles and TV shows about her work with chimpanzees. She wrote many books, including children's books and a popular book called In the Shadow of Man. This book has been translated into 47 languages and is still available today. Jane Goodall is one of the most famous female scientists of the 20th century. 

Many stories have been told about her life, but they often focus on her as a girl who loved adventure or a woman who wanted to work with animals. These stories do not show all the important things she has done. Jane Goodall is a very important scientist because she helped us understand how chimpanzees live and feel. 

Before Jane's work, people thought chimpanzees were very dangerous. No one knew that chimpanzees eat meat or use tools. We also did not know that chimpanzees have feelings like humans and live in social groups like us. Jane's book, The Chimpanzees of Gombe, is very important for studying chimpanzees. 

Jane Goodall changed how we study animals. She helped us understand that chimpanzees are our closest relatives. Even as a child, Jane showed her love for animals. When she was five years old, she wanted to know how hens lay eggs. One day, she crawled into a henhouse and waited quietly for five hours to see how it happened. This was the start of her journey as a biologist.

Shirley Ford is a voice actor. She can make many different voices. In one hour, she talks like a funny 8-year-old boy, a tired mother, an old Scottish woman, and a fast-talking alien. People know her voices from children’s TV shows and cartoons. 

Shirley says, “I just did a voice for a video about back injuries. I had to learn many medical words.” She explains that doing voiceovers is not easy. Many actors think they can do funny voices, but it is more than that. You must make the words exciting for people who cannot see you. Many famous actors want to do voiceovers, but they often do not get the job because they are used to acting with their whole body.

After school, Shirley took a drama course. She wanted to be a regular actor. Sometimes, she sang for TV ads. One day, the man at the recording studio asked her to try out for a rabbit in a cartoon. She thought it was silly, but she tried and got the part. Shirley found out she could do voices and liked voiceover work. 

In her second film, she played the main character and also her brother and mother. Women actors often do the voices for small boys and girls because their voices are higher. It is hard to find child actors, so companies like to use adult women instead. 

Shirley learned to make different sounds and to watch children’s TV to get new voices. She enjoys working on cartoons the most. She says, “Sometimes, I have to sound happy about things I don’t care about, but I learned to smile when I talk. It makes my voice sound bright.” 

Shirley says it is hard to get voiceover jobs. A good showreel, which is a recording of what you can do, is very important. She believes it is good to invest in a strong showreel. There are agencies that help voice actors make them. 

Shirley worked hard to be successful. She says, “You must make your showreel and show it to film and TV companies. You must practice your voices and never give up.” 

For people who want to be voice actors, Shirley suggests going to special workshops. She loves voices and becomes the characters she plays. She says, “If I do an American voice, I might talk like that for hours or days. My children are used to me talking in different voices.”

Text: "People often ask me how I became a cartoonist. This is normal because many kids dream of being cartoonists, like they dream of being race car drivers. But most people stop dreaming and choose other jobs, like being a lawyer or making car parts. It seems silly to think you can make money by drawing funny pictures. But some people do this. 

Many cartoonists wanted to be cartoonists for a long time. I loved comic strips when I was a kid. I drew pictures for my school and everyone knew me as 'the kid who draws.' I studied graphic design in college. After college, I showed my drawings to different companies. I was lucky to find a newspaper that wanted political cartoons. I drew some ideas, and they bought them. Soon, I was making enough money to live.

You don’t need a university degree to be a cartoonist. You don’t need a lot of money or even to be a great artist. You just need your brain, your hand, and something to draw with. But it is not easy to be a cartoonist. It is better to have other skills too. I have done political cartoons, comic strips, and comic books. I have also written and designed. I take any job because I can learn from all kinds of work. It helps to be smart and curious about the world.

What about the business side of being a cartoonist? In the past, many cartoonists had regular jobs with newspapers and magazines. Now, most cartoonists have to sell their own work. If you are good at selling, you will do better. I have seen cartoonists who are not very creative but are good at business do better than very talented artists who do not know how to sell.

Some people worry too much about others stealing their ideas. They are scared to show their work. To protect your drawings, you can write a small ‘c’ for ‘copyright’ and put your name and the date next to it. But really, it is more likely that no one will care about your work. If someone takes your cartoon and it becomes popular online, it is not a disaster. It can be a lucky chance!"

Text: 

Twenty years ago, I was moving to a new house. I was cleaning out my things. I decided to throw away an electric guitar. My dad gave it to me for my 16th birthday. It was a nice black guitar. I usually do not like to throw things away, but I did this time. I took it to the dump. Just as I was going to put it in the rubbish, a young man came to me. He looked confused and said, “You are not going to throw that away, are you?” I said yes, and he asked if he could have it. I said yes, and we went our own ways. 

After that, I felt sad about giving it away. A few months ago, I got an email that changed my life. I remembered a story about a man who lost his wedding ring in the ocean. Ten years later, he found it in a fish at a restaurant. I felt like that when I opened the email. It was from a man named Keith Rushton. He said, “I have your electric guitar.” 

He found my guitar after it was sold many times. He saw my name on a label on the back of the guitar. He used my name to find me online. He contacted me through the newspaper I work for and wanted to sell it back to me. I was very happy. I would have given him anything, but his price was fair. I remembered how my dad liked to put name labels on my things, even my guitar. 

My parents wanted me to learn the classical guitar. In the 1970s, many people liked classical guitar. I loved the sound; it was calm and gentle. But I did not get better at it. So, I switched to the electric guitar. At that time, punk music was popular. People who could not play well could still be rock stars. 

When I opened the box with my old guitar, I remembered my birthday in 1978. My parents smiled and gave me the guitar. When I held it again, it felt smooth and smaller than I remembered. I sat down to play, but then I wanted to stand up. I put a strap on my shoulder because you play electric guitar while standing. My fingers knew what to do. I could not draw the chords, but my hands remembered. My fingers felt the pain of pressing the strings to play. 

The electric guitar is not just for one person. Now that I am learning it again, I want to form a band. My son is learning the saxophone. Maybe we can play together. Or maybe I can find other people my age who want to play. We could call ourselves “The Regainers”!

People are talking a lot about sleep. I wrote a book called Insomniac. It is about people who cannot sleep. I think sleep is very important for our minds and bodies. People who have trouble sleeping know how important sleep is. It is good that people are talking about sleep now. 

But what about dreams? I do not hear much about dreams. When you wake up early, you lose sleep. This lost sleep is mostly REM sleep. REM stands for Rapid Eye Movement. This is when we have the most dreams. A good sleeper spends about one-fourth of their sleep time in REM. If a person lives for 90 years, they will spend six or seven years dreaming in REM.

When scientists take away REM sleep, people dream more the next night. This shows that dreams are important. In 1953, scientists found REM sleep. Sigmund Freud, a famous psychologist, said that dreams help us understand our minds. But later studies showed that this is not so simple. Now, scientists study dreams more for their physical reasons than for their psychological reasons.

Robert Stickgold, a sleep scientist, says that scientists do not agree on many things about dreams. Dreams are important. A study by P.F. Pagel found that actors, writers, and directors remember and use their dreams better than other people. This means that creative people use their dreams more. 

Stickgold says that dreams help us think in new ways. They help us connect old and new ideas. For example, when people wake up from REM sleep and think of a word, their ideas are more original than when they wake from other sleep stages. They think of surprising connections. 

I write better when I wake up from strong dreams. Even a bad dream can help me think better. On those days, I can write quickly. I do not know how it works, but it helps. 

Creativity is not just for writers or artists. We all need to think well in our lives. We need to dream to help us think creatively and solve problems with others. This is why dreams are important.

2. What does REM stand for?
3. How long do people spend dreaming if they live for 90 years?
4. Who said that dreams help us understand our minds?
5. What do creative people do with their dreams?

Text: 

Twenty years ago, Susie Ray left London. She moved to a small town by the sea in south-west England. When you enter her studio, you see a beautiful view of the sea. There are many empty frames on the walls and pictures of her two daughters. Susie is a copyist artist. She can paint copies of famous paintings very well. 

"I don’t keep my own paintings," Susie says. "As soon as I finish them, I sell them." Many people want her work. In her 30 years as a copyist, she has painted many famous artists like Renoir, Monet, and Van Gogh. Her copies look so real that experts sometimes think they are the original paintings. 

Her copies can sell for a few hundred pounds to £12,000, depending on how long she works on them. Susie does not tell the names of her clients, but they include art galleries and private collectors. Some collectors want to show off their art. One famous buyer likes to say he has a ‘Van Gogh’ painting, but it is really a ‘Susie Ray Van Gogh’. 

Susie is honest about her work. When she copies a painting, she tries to make it look real. She puts her name on the back of the canvas. It is illegal to sell a copy as an original. Susie knows people who have done this, but she does not want to. She is not very rich, but her life is better now. 

Before being a copyist, Susie worked as an illustrator at a botanical garden. She did this for many years and learned a lot. She had to be very careful and get things right. She is happy she found a job that pays better. 

When young artists ask her for advice, she tells them to learn to draw well. She has studied a lot to do her job. She can draw many things, but she likes to copy French impressionist paintings the most. 

Some people think modern art is easy. But Susie says impressionist painters worked quickly and carefully. It is hard to do both. 

People wonder why Susie does not create her own art. She says her work is the result of many years of practice, and she makes a good living. She has tried to paint her own things, but they did not turn out well. Susie is a perfectionist.

Bonnie Wyndham got out of her mother’s car and looked at Almonside School. “I will make you sorry I came here,” she said to the school, smiling. Her mother was getting out of the car too, so she did not hear Bonnie. Bonnie didn’t care if she did. Her mother knew how Bonnie felt. 

Mrs. Wyndham looked around. Almonside was a strange school with many buildings hidden in the trees. It was confusing at first. Then she saw signs: Science block, gym, riding centre… “Riding centre,” said Bonnie, suddenly interested. “Headmaster’s study,” said her mother. “This way.” Bonnie followed her mother along a wide path between the trees. “I wish you would walk with me instead of behind me,” said Mrs. Wyndham tiredly, but she did not expect Bonnie to do it.

A few minutes later, Mrs. Wyndham was talking to Bonnie’s new headmaster in his office, while Bonnie waited outside. Suddenly, Bonnie stood up. “Why should I just sit here?” she said to herself. “I will be thrown out soon anyway,” she said to the door, “so why not go now?” She left the building and went to the riding centre.

There was a nice old building for the horses and a big place for indoor riding. Bonnie looked around, but there was no one there. She walked carefully to the horses. Bonnie treated horses with respect. The horses were well cared for. Almost every stall had a horse, and she looked at each one. “I know what you are doing here,” she said to a small pony, touching its nose. 

Then she saw the next horse. “But aren’t you the best!” she said. He was brown with a little white. He looked lively, and Bonnie liked that. “I feel like we have met before,” she said, stroking his neck. His name was Maverick. Bonnie wanted to ride him. “I wonder where I can find a bridle and a saddle,” she thought. 

The room with the riding equipment was open. Happy, she put a saddle on Maverick’s back and forgot about her mother and the headmaster. When she sat on the big horse outside, she felt like a queen. At her old school, they called her Queen Bee, and she laughed when she remembered it. “You are the best horse I have ever ridden, Maverick,” she said. “I know about horses, even if I don’t know about anything else.” 

She nudged him to walk, then to trot. “If I stay here, I think we could be great friends,” she said. She went around the paddock. The rhythm was exciting, and a little breeze made her cheek feel warm. She could tell Maverick trusted her, and she felt sure he would jump well.

I met Cody Simpson before. He is a quiet and confident person. Cody is 15 years old and comes from Australia. He has made many popular songs. 

Cody started playing guitar when he was six years old. He began writing songs when he was seven. He loved swimming and surfing. These were his favorite activities. When he was 13, he went to high school and posted some videos online.

I jumped out of bed and looked out the window. I saw the river. There was a crack in the ice shining in the sunlight. I looked at the sandbags. They help stop the water from flooding when the ice melts. My back hurt from moving the sandbags. Last week, I worked with many people in the town for a long time. I wanted to show I could help. My grandfather did not notice much. 

I looked at the river. There was dark water from the factory. The ice was on both sides of the water. I took off my pajamas and put on my kayaking wetsuit. I saw a boy on the other side of the river. I did not know him. He was trying to stand on the ice near the warm water. I zipped up my wetsuit and put on my kayaking jacket. I checked my pocket for my lucky chain. It is a silver chain my grandfather gave me. Only my mom, my grandfather, and I know about it. I also have my grandfather's diary from his trip to South America. I read it before I sleep. 

I went to the kitchen. “Good morning, Rex,” my mom said. She smiled at me as I took a banana. “You are up early for Saturday. I will make brunch after your training. Be careful.” “Thanks, Mom.” I walked down the hall and almost bumped into my grandfather. “Watch where you are going!” he shouted. “Where are you going?” “Sorry, Grandpa. I am going kayaking.” He should know that by now. 

“Why train? You did not win the competition,” he said. His words hurt me. I took a deep breath and counted to three. He went to the bathroom and slammed the door. My mom smiled at me. “Don’t worry about him. He’s…” “...not himself right now,” I said. I wanted to say he is always like this, but I didn’t. I remember when I was a child, he was my hero. He showed me pictures of his trips. Those pictures are still on his wall with his medals. But I do not go into his room anymore. I have my own trophies now. I hope to be in National Geographic one day. 

My mom smiled. “At least he is coming out of his room more. Have a good training, Rex. I admire your hard work, even in the cold!” I smiled back as I peeled my banana. “It will be warmer in South America if I find sponsors for my trip.” She laughed and went back to the kitchen. I finished my banana and went outside. I walked quickly to the boathouse.

Mum took Jess by the arm. “Come with me,” she said. Jess followed her to the study. On the table, there was a painting. It was not in a frame and it looked like Grandpa’s work, but it was different and not finished. 

“Do you know anything about this?” Mum asked. Jess shook her head. “I’ve never seen it before. I didn’t know he was painting.” Jess looked at the picture. There was a river in it. It was not a river she knew, maybe it was a made-up river. The picture was strange and beautiful. The riverbank was very small, with a little green. The river looked pale and went to a hidden sea. There were no animals, no birds, and no people. It felt right that way. Jess thought about autumn after summer.

Mum said, “It has a name.” There was something in her voice that showed she was excited. Jess knew why. Grandpa never named his paintings. He just painted them. Mum turned the picture over and pointed to the words Grandpa wrote. Jess read them: “River Boy.” The words felt important to her, but she didn’t know why. 

Jess looked at Mum. “There is no boy.” 

“Exactly. It’s strange for him to be so specific. Maybe he will add the boy later. I asked him about it once.” 

“Mum! You should have known better.” 

“I know, but I couldn’t help it. It’s such a strange picture. You can guess what he said.” 

Jess didn’t need to guess. She knew Grandpa would say, “It’s not the artist’s job to explain a painting. Each picture has its own meaning, like a poem. We either understand it or we don’t.” 

Mum laughed. “He said something like that. I was hoping you might know something about this painting because you inspire him.” 

“Inspire?” 

“Someone who helps an artist.” Jess knew the word. Grandpa often said it when she watched him paint. But he never said it was about her. She thought it meant a goddess, not a person. It was hard to think anyone could inspire Grandpa. 

“He doesn’t need me to inspire him,” she said. “He has painted all his life.”

This morning, I woke up and did not want to cut a hole in my carpet. I did not mean to do it. Maybe it was an accident. I could have tripped over my bed with a knife in my hand. The knife might have gone into the carpet by itself. I did not want to damage the carpet. I did not wake up and think, "Today I will cut my carpet." It seemed like a good idea at the time. Later, I wondered why I thought that. This happens to me a lot. 

I was not thinking about cutting the carpet. I was trying to fit my corner cabinet into a corner. My grandma gave me the cabinet when she moved to a flat. It is small and painted white with pink and blue flowers. Grandma kept pretty things in it. I keep my shells and stones there. I was very happy when she gave it to me!

The cabinet is a corner cabinet. It has to go in a corner. My bedroom is small and has only two corners. The big bedroom is for my parents, the back room is for my sister Angela, and the little room is for my brother Tom. My room is very small, like a broom cupboard. 

Mum says when Angela goes to university, Tom can have her room, and I can have Tom's room. But Angela is only fifteen, so I think I will be in my small room for a long time. I like my little bedroom. It is cozy, like a nest. The roof is sloped, and the window is low. 

The problem is, I do not have enough corners! My bed is in one corner, and my wardrobe is in the other. I tried to fit Grandma’s cabinet in the space between the roof and the floor, but it was too tall. I thought, if I cannot cut the cabinet, maybe I can cut a hole in the carpet. It seemed like a good idea. My dad says to "think outside the box," and that is what I was trying to do!

Text: 'The book ‘The Borrowers’ is about a family of tiny people. They live in the walls and floors of a house. They take things from normal-sized people to survive. When I was asked to make a TV show from the book, I knew it would be hard. People who love the book have strong ideas about it. I used the original drawings from the book because I did not want people to say I did it wrong. The author wanted the show to be from the Borrowers' view, not from the humans' view. This made filming more difficult. 

The most important thing was to show the right size. The Borrowers are ten times smaller than humans. So, when we filmed the Borrowers walking or going on their missions, we had to be ten times further away than normal. The crew had to crawl on the ground and film from very low, about 15 centimeters high, to show the Borrowers' view. They wore out many pairs of jeans! We only raised the cameras for special shots. 

One big problem was to make the shadows look right when we combined the tiny Borrowers with the normal-sized background. We made a special way to do this. After the show, the famous director George Lucas called me to ask how I did it. 

We built only one set, which was the Borrowers' home under the floor. It had big objects to make the actors look small. It was very fun. I remember the coins; they were bigger than dinner plates and hard to lift. We often stopped filming because the crew laughed so much. In the story, there is a scene where the Borrowers go down a drain. To film this, the actors had to go down a tunnel with hoses. They said it was very scary, so they did not have to act. 

It was important to me to get the costumes right. I had them made from heavy material so they looked like dolls' clothes. This made it hard for the main actress to move. She could not sit down during breaks and had to be sewn into her dress every morning. The lead actor wore trousers made from a rug because normal fabric looked too smooth. Unfortunately, it was very hot during filming. I don’t think they liked the costumes! 

Most of the action away from the Borrowers' home was filmed with the actors in front of a blue screen. It was hard for them to act with things that were not really there. I drew pictures of every scene to show how they should look. I drew 2,000 pictures in total. They were not perfect, but they helped. We did not have enough money for special effects studios during the day, so I worked nights for three months. 

We had to work fast. One time, I filmed a whole scene and then realized there was no film in the camera! But in the end, everything came together, and I think the show was successful in showing the magic of the books.'

Text: 

Mom stops the car at my new school, Palm Grove High School. She looks around, worried about reporters, but there are none. I know things will get crazy soon. There will be fake smiles and people wanting things from me. “Everything will be fine,” I tell her. She kisses my cheek before I get out of the car. Now I am alone at this new school. But I wanted this. I wanted to leave my old life of traveling and tutors. The band is here for a short time, but I am staying for good. I want to meet normal kids. 

I walk into the school office. “Hi, I need my schedule, please,” I say to the secretary. “Name?” she asks, looking serious. “Desert McGraw.” “Desirée?” she asks, confused. “Desert,” I say again. She types my last name on her computer. Not many people know my last name because my dad uses a stage name. “What grade?” she asks. “Eleventh.” “One second, it’s printing,” she says. She gives me my schedule. My first class is English Literature. I like English. I will be late because my class is on the second floor. I studied the map last night so I wouldn’t get lost.

When I get to the classroom, the teacher is calling names. I quietly enter and sit at the back. The girl next to me smiles. She looks at my outfit – jeans and a T-shirt. “Nice shoes,” she whispers. I look down at my fancy shoes. Oh no, I shouldn’t have worn these. “Thanks,” I say. The teacher calls my name. “Desert McGraw?” “Here,” I reply. The teacher smiles and says her name is Ms. Smigla. She talks a lot and gives us our course outlines. After that, she lets us talk to each other!

“Why did you move here?” my new friend asks. I have a few answers. I could say I want a normal life away from cameras and reporters. Or I could say what my dad said: “We need a change, Desert.” “My dad had to move,” I tell her. “What does he do?” she asks. I know everyone will find out soon, but I want to pretend to be normal for a while. “He’s an artist,” I say, playing with my backpack. “Cool. I’m Becca, by the way.” She seems nice.
