The Earth to Sky Calculus Club is a group of teenagers. They live in Bishop, a small mountain town in the US. This town is near big mountains and nature. The club has sent over fifty balloons into the sky, about 35 km high. They do this to learn about space and have fun.

One weekend in spring, I joined them. They were going to send a balloon up to see shooting stars. Shooting stars are bright lights in the sky when a rock or metal comes into the Earth's atmosphere. 

As it got dark, the teenagers put a soft lunch box on the balloon. Inside the lunch box, there was a camera, a tool to measure how high the balloon goes, and a thermometer to check the temperature. They also put two GPS trackers on the outside to find the lunch box later. They used a gas tank to fill the balloon, which got very big, like a small car. An older boy drove a long way to get the gas tank.

Finally, it was time to let the balloon go. They counted down: "Five, four, three, two, one," and the balloon went up into the sky. Some of the kids ran and used flashlights to see it for as long as they could. Then the balloon disappeared.

After the launch, most students went home, but a few stayed to watch the shooting stars. They lay on blankets and looked at the clear sky. I saw a boy get into a sleeping bag and fall asleep. One girl said, "We are the only ones talking." Another girl whispered, "I know." Then, a shooting star went across the sky.

As the balloon went up, it got bigger and bigger until it popped. A parachute helped the lunch box come back down safely. The next day, the students used the GPS trackers to find it. It was not easy to get back, but that was part of the fun. The lunch box usually lands in a place with no people around.

The leader of the group said, "Recovering the lunch box is a big part of the project." They had lost only two lunch boxes in 53 tries. This time, the lunch box landed 84 km from Bishop. The team had to drive a long way to find it. They had to decide if they should drive or walk to get it. It could be hard if the lunch box was on a high mountain or in a tall tree.

The leader said, "These students know this area well. What is hard for some people is normal for them." It took them 11 hours to find the lunch box. It was in a canyon, on a rock, near a waterfall. The camera did not catch any shooting stars. This was a little sad, but it gave them a chance to talk about science and share their adventure stories.

When you travel by car with your family, you often ask, "Are we there yet?" Even if you are six years old, you know you are not there. When you arrive, it is not "there" anymore; it is "here." 

Kids often ask this question many times. Parents hear it a lot on long trips. Kids might think it is hard, but they can relax in the back seat. They can watch movies, listen to music, or do puzzles while looking at the nice views outside the window. 

In the front seat, mom or dad drives the car. They give juice boxes and cookies and change the radio. They help make the trip nice. 

But sometimes, kids fight in the back seat. For example, my younger brother, Tim, puts his foot on my side of the seat. I do not like this, so I put my foot on his side. Then we start to fight. Mom or Dad tell us to stop and stay in our own seats. 

Later, I try to read, but I feel something on my arm. Tim is next to me, breathing on me. He is not touching me, but it makes me angry. 

Dad has ways to deal with us. When we ask, "Are we there yet?" he sometimes says, "Yes, we are here. Get out of the car." But we are still driving. 

You know you are really "there" when the adults get out of the car and go far away from the kids. So remember, if mom and dad are still close, the answer is: no, you are not there yet.

---

**Questions:**

1. What do kids often ask when they are in the car?
2. What can kids do in the back seat during the trip?
3. Who drives the car?
4. What does Tim do that makes the narrator angry?
5. How does Dad answer the question "Are we there yet?" sometimes?

Text: 

John and Zuzi Morgan have opened a café in Oxford, UK. In their café, people can drink coffee, eat cake, and play board games. John and Zuzi want people to enjoy their time and come back again. 

Zuzi says they started this café because they love board games. She thinks many people spend too much time on their phones and computers. They want to help people talk and have fun together. 

In their café, people play games called ‘Eurogames’. These games are about simple things like farming and building. One popular game is called The Settlers of Catan. In this game, players build homes on an island and trade things with each other. Everyone can join in and have fun together. 

Another game is called Pandemic. In this game, players work as a team to solve problems. It was made by Matt Leacock, who loves board games. He wanted to make games that make people feel good, whether they win or lose. 

Matt remembers when he was a child. He loved getting board games for his birthday, but sometimes he was disappointed when they were not fun. So, he and his uncle tried to make better games. Pandemic became very popular and has a lot of stories in it. 

Today, many people play video games on their phones and computers. This has helped more people enjoy board games too. Ben Hogg, who works for a game company, says that many people now like to play games. 

Before, people played video games together in the same room. Now, many play online and do not see each other. Some of these people want to play games with friends in person again. 

In John and Zuzi's busy café, board games are more than just fun. They help people connect and enjoy time together in the real world.

**Simplified Text:**

Jamie Scott is a musician from the UK. He has written many popular songs. His story shows that hard work is important in music, even if you start slowly. Jamie says his mother was a great singer and she helped him learn to play the guitar. He only listened to local radio when he was young, which influenced his music. He was 12 years old when he heard a modern song for the first time.

When he was younger, Jamie played tennis at a high level. But he liked music more. He spent his lunch breaks in the music room at school. At 17, he left school to become a performer. He worked with a friend who played guitar but did not want to be a performer. Jamie told his parents that he wanted to make music. His dad said he had 18 months to succeed, or he would need to find a job.

At 19, Jamie got a deal with a music publisher after writing one song. But the music labels wanted him to be a solo artist, so he had to stop working with his friend. He had some hard times with a record label in the UK. He asked to leave and joined another label to make a new album, but he did not become famous right away.

Jamie believes he was often in the wrong place at the wrong time as an artist. But as a songwriter, he felt he was in the right place. He helps new artists and wants to write big songs that many people will listen to. He tells artists that it is okay to want to write popular music. He wants to create great songs that can be number one on the charts.

Jamie is honest about his goals. He wants to write the best music and make classic pop songs. He focuses on making good music instead of worrying about what others think.

**Simplified Text:**

Tony Connor is a new kind of celebrity. He is very popular online, but many people do not know him if they do not watch videos of bike tricks. He is a "street trials cyclist." This means he jumps from hard places like roofs and walls to land safely in other strange places. People film his tricks and put them online.

I met Tony in a BMX park on a Saturday morning. The local boys know him well. Some older people also come to see him and call him "an absolute legend." After watching him, I agree. At first, I was not sure about him, but I was surprised by his bravery and creativity. Before each jump, he tells us what he will do, and sometimes I think he cannot do it. But when I tell him he did a great job, he does not seem very happy.

Tony says he does not like being famous. He finds it hard to talk to fans. He prefers to do things instead of just talking about them. This is funny because he is famous because of social media and cameras. He says, "This technology helps people like me earn money." He feels that many people are always looking at their phones, and he does not like that.

Tony makes good money from his videos. He has learned that two things help a child become a great athlete: energy and the ability to handle disappointment. These are very important, even more than talent. The more dangerous the sport, the more mental strength you need. 

In the park, Tony fell a few times on some easy obstacles. But he got up and kept trying until he did it right. Some people think he is a hero, but others say he is too risky. He says, "People who say this may care, but they do not understand. They probably have never tried riding a trials bike and do not know the sport well. I get advice from experts to stay safe."

Tony is careful about the risks he takes. He says, "People are different. Some are not scared, and they should not do these sports. It is smart to know the dangers. Some people cannot get over their fear, but I can. I feel scared, but I find a way to jump. I am not addicted to risk. I plan a lot and sometimes ride around to get ready before a new jump. I know I must stay calm before I jump. If I focus, I will be fine." 

**Questions:**

1. What is Tony Connor famous for?
2. Where did the interview with Tony take place?
3. How do local boys feel about Tony?
4. What does Tony think about being famous?
5. What two things help a child become a great athlete, according to Tony?

Text: 'Helen Skelton is a TV presenter. She has done many dangerous things for charity. She ran a marathon in the desert and traveled down the Amazon river in a small boat. For her new challenge, Helen walked on a high wire. This wire was 66 metres above the ground, between two tall towers. There was no safety net. She wore a belt that was attached to another wire above her. To help her balance, she carried a long stick that weighed eight kilograms. 

Helen learned from an expert high-wire walker. She had some circus skills, but high-wire walking was very different. Helen said, “The training was a shock. I didn’t know I needed to be so strong.” Every day, she started at 8 am. First, she ran up a steep hill. Then, she did exercises for one hour. After that, she practiced on the wire for another hour. She also learned how to fall safely on the wire. When she fell, it hurt a lot. But she tried to stay positive. If she was nervous, the wire would shake!

On the day of the challenge, it was windy. Helen took deep breaths and moved slowly on the wire. The walk was 150 metres long and took 15 minutes. After, she said, “That was the scariest thing I’ve done. I’m glad it’s over!” But Helen is not done. She is planning her next charity project: to reach the South Pole by ski, kite, and bike.'

Text: 'In 2006, Jeff Somers started a trip around the world on a penny farthing. A penny farthing is an old bicycle with one big wheel and one small wheel. Jeff had written a book about his travels in Canada in a very old car. He loved cars and worked on racing car engines. To save money, Jeff rode an old bicycle to work. He also used it to go to Amsterdam for a holiday. Jeff says, “That trip opened my eyes. I decided to see the world by bike.” 

Jeff did not want a normal bike. He wanted to build a special one. He thought a penny farthing was the craziest bike. He went to a museum to learn how to make one. After trying two times in 2001 and 2003, he finally started his trip in 2006. He traveled for three years and visited 23 countries on four continents. The best part of his trip was arriving in Tibet and seeing Mount Everest. 

Jeff met other cyclists who could ride up mountains, but he was happy with his penny farthing. People were very surprised to see it. His worst moment was when he had to drink dirty water from a stream. He got very sick and stayed in a hostel for ten days without medicine. He had no money for a hospital or to go home. But now, Jeff says, “If I could afford it, I would travel again tomorrow on my penny farthing.”'

Text: "I work at a university in the US. My team and I study water birds, especially the American black duck. We have a new tool called a ‘night-vision scope’. This tool helps us see the ducks at night. We are worried about black ducks because their numbers are very low. We do not know if there is enough food for them on the east coast. 

We know a lot about what they do in the day, but we do not know what they do at night. The night-vision scope will help us see clearly, even when there is no moon. This will help us learn more and take care of the ducks better.

There are four people on my team. We work six hours every day. We study ducks in different places. Sometimes, I take a boat to see the ducks and write down what I see. The weather is not always good. Some nights are warm, but many nights are wet. It is very quiet, and I drink a lot of coffee to stay awake! 

We missed one day of work because there was too much snow. I like this work, even if it is hard. In summer, we will work in a laboratory and look at our results. It will be hard to be inside, but it is important. I would not change this job for anything!"

Text: "I have a very special job. I work with chocolate! People are surprised when I tell them this. My job is to taste chocolate to make sure it is good for customers. Every week, I get small samples of chocolate from our factory. I check the taste, texture, and smell. I also taste the nuts and fruit we use in the chocolate. I choose the best ones for our chocolate.

I have a kitchen next to my office. In this kitchen, I can make and taste new chocolate products. I share samples with my colleagues, and they like it! My kitchen has many machines and ingredients. It is nice to have my own space at work.

Every day is different in my job. Sometimes I work in the lab, and sometimes I travel to buy ingredients. I have a young family, so this can be hard. But I like the variety in my job. People often ask me if I get bored of chocolate. I have worked with chocolate for a long time, and I still love it. I even eat chocolate at home in the evening!"

Text: 'Have you ever thought about what it is like to work in a circus? Sophia Grayson works at Circus Experience. This is a place that teaches young people circus skills. She says many people like her course because it teaches many skills. You can learn to juggle, throw and catch balls, and even do trapeze, which is flying in the air above an audience. 

The course lasts one year. Students learn to take more risks in each class. Parents can come to some classes to see how their children are doing. Sophia says, “To be a circus performer, you need to do different things. It is important to keep your shows exciting. If you want to be good in the circus, you must practice a lot. 

Another good thing is making friends with other performers and learning from them. Being fit is very important too. Circus artists train every day to stay strong. Training is important, but the best performers are those who want to be successful, have ideas, and keep getting better. 

Some people think circus performers get hurt a lot or only work a little each year. But the real thing to think about is the future. You can only travel and perform when you are young, and then you need to think about other jobs.” The course also teaches business skills. Many students start their own businesses around the world and like to share their stories. Sophia says, however, that this job is not for making a lot of money! “The work usually does not give you a regular salary. It is also very competitive, but it is a lot of fun!”'

Text: 

You may not know her name, but you have probably heard her sing. Mariam Hobson is a backing singer. This means she sings behind the main singer. Many people think backing singers are not as good as lead singers, but that is not true. They are very talented! Mariam says, “I love my job because I never know what I will sing when I go to the studio. It can be classical, jazz, hip-hop, or rock music. Sometimes, I sing funny songs for radio or ads. Once, I was asked to sing like a fish underwater! I never argue; I just do my job!”

Mariam needs to be a good singer and learn quickly. Sometimes, there is no music to read. She remembers her first time recording music for a film. It was hard because there were eight singers, and each one sang a different part. There was also an orchestra. She was scared because if she made a mistake, they would have to record everything again. Recording takes a long time!

One of her favorite jobs is recording for songwriters. Some songwriters do not know what sounds good for a female voice. When they hear Mariam sing their song, they can see how to make it better.

Text: 'Julie Deane started with little knowledge about fashion. She made a successful business with her bags called ‘satchels’. These bags are used by schoolchildren. Now, they are sold in famous shops and many celebrities use them. Before making satchels, Julie thought about different businesses, like cake decorating and party planning. She wanted to choose the best idea. Some people said there was no need for satchels, but Julie believed in her idea. She worked with her mother, who is good at business, and got ideas from children’s storybooks. 

At first, Julie sold one satchel a week. To get more people interested, she sent satchels to fashion writers and asked them to write about them. They did, and more people wanted to buy them. Now, Julie is excited to see which celebrity uses her satchel! While other companies spend money on ads, Julie gets ideas from the internet to make new styles. 

There was a hard time when another company copied her design. Now, Julie makes sure she trusts her production team. People who visit her office say it feels good to be there. There is a new factory, but it is the team that makes it special.'

Text: 

When Vicky Harmiston was a child, her parents let her and her brother Jamie choose what to do in their free time. Vicky liked to play many sports. She was a good swimmer, and her coach thought she could be a champion. But the swimming club was far from her home, so it was hard for her to train and do her schoolwork.

When they were teenagers, Jamie loved cycling. He bought a special bike and started to race. Vicky thought this was exciting and wanted to try it too. She says it was the best choice she ever made. Soon, she was cycling every day and doing very well. The track was near her school, so it was easy for her to go to training after school.

Vicky became a successful track cyclist and won many competitions. When she was 28, she stopped racing. Vicky said, “I loved winning, but I got tired of it. When the fun stops, there is no reason to continue. Luckily, I found a new job.”

Vicky got a job with a charity called CycleZone. “We help young people who do not like sports,” she says. “First, we teach them to ride a bike. We want them to believe in themselves. CycleZone is great because it brings young people together.”

The charity uses famous people to help them. Vicky says, “Some people think having a celebrity is not always good for a charity. They say celebrities want to be famous, and this can hide the real work of the charity. But if famous singers and actors can help, I think they should.”

Text: 

Ana Ronson is a singer and songwriter. She grew up in Ireland. Her parents did not play music, but there was always music at home. Her grandfather played the guitar and taught Ana and her brother how to play.

The first time Ana sang in front of people was at school. She was very nervous, and her teacher had to help her off the stage. The teacher said Ana should join the school theatre club to feel better. After some time in the club, Ana sang happily with 50 other students at a concert.

A year later, Ana's brother asked her to write a song for his band. She wrote her first song called "Falling Stars" in three days. She liked it so much that she took a songwriting course with a professional. Even though she was the youngest student, she knew a lot about music. But Ana felt the teacher did not listen to her. She wrote a song called "Something to Say" about this feeling. She shared this song online, and many people liked it.

Joss Alton, who owns a music company called Isotope Music, came to ask Ana to join his company. At first, Ana was not sure. She did not know the company and did not want someone to tell her what to sing. But Joss said this would not happen. Soon after, Ana sang at a concert in Dublin that Isotope arranged. All the tickets sold quickly, and it was a great night.

Ana likes to write songs about real life. One of her favorite songs is "Decision." It is about her brother and why he stopped singing for a while. Ana hopes her fans will like her songs, but she wants to write about things that are important to her.

Text: "Last year, I went on a great trip. I traveled by boat on a group tour along the west coast of Canada. It was my brother Harry’s idea. He is a journalist, like me, and he wanted to write about the trip. He loves boats, but I do not. I wanted to visit this place because our great-grandparents lived there before they moved to Europe. I asked Harry many times if I could go with him, and he finally said yes!

A few days before we left, there were storms where we were going. But the weather was good for the days we would be there. I was busy at work, so I did not have time to plan. But Harry said he would take care of everything, so I felt better.

When we arrived in Canada, we joined the group, packed our things into small boats, and started our trip. The guide said very few people live along that coast. On the first morning, we saw dolphins and birds. There were islands far away, but the fog made it hard to see. I looked at the beautiful waves our boat made in the water.

We often stopped to explore the rock pools on the beaches. They had many colorful fish that I did not know. It was nice to forget about time. We always remembered to eat lunch and dinner, which we cooked together over campfires. At night, we slept on the boats. The beds were hard, but it felt good to relax.

When it was time to go home, I felt sad. I did not want to return to normal life. But I knew I would miss my family and friends. I was also excited to tell everyone at home about our adventures!"

Text: "My dad was a basketball player in Germany. His dad was a player too. When I was a kid, I went to watch my dad's games. I did not love basketball. I liked to tell my friends how good my dad was, especially when he won. But I took a book to read instead of watching the games.

When I started secondary school, I was very tall. My sports teacher asked me to join the basketball team. I liked the practice, but I thought I needed to get better before playing a real game. The teacher believed in me. After some weeks, I played a game against another school. My parents came to watch, and I was nervous. But it was OK!

For four years, I practiced every day and did well. I even joined an adult team. When I was fifteen, I moved to the USA to go to a special sports school. The coach there trains Olympic players. It was great to work with him. But I missed my parents. At home, I could not spend much time with my friends because of training, so that was not a big change for me. I got used to my new life, and my English got better!

I became a professional player when I was eighteen. I was taller than most players, but I needed to get stronger. My coach knew a team that would take me while I was still in school, so I joined them. I have never regretted it."

Text: "Seven years ago, I studied Tourism at college. My course was expensive, so I needed a part-time job. I decided to become a weekend tour guide in my city, Chicago, USA. I took visitors around the city, and I enjoyed it a lot. I saw my city in a new way every time!

After I finished my studies, I wanted to be a tour guide full-time. I thought it would be easy, but I learned that I needed to know a lot more. To be a full-time tour guide in Chicago, I had to answer many questions about the city, like its history and public transport rules. After some hard but fun months, I got my tour guide qualification.

Being a tour guide is not just about facts. You need to tell interesting stories and be ready for changes. Sometimes, places are closed when you arrive, or the route changes. Tourists want to enjoy their tour, not hear about problems. I want my visitors to be happy. If they are not, they might write a bad review online. Good reviews are important because they help me get more customers. I try to make my tours fun and easy. I love my job, and because of this, I usually get good reviews. Many visitors recommend my tours in Chicago."

Text: "My name is Ella. I am 22 years old. Last year, I went to Thailand for two weeks with my sister, Josie. Josie is five years younger than me, but we get along well. We went to help at an elephant sanctuary. This is a place where people take care of sick elephants. At first, I was nervous because the other volunteers were older than us. It was also our first time doing this kind of work. But in the end, we had fun.

One of our jobs was to collect food for the elephants. Elephants eat a lot of grass and bananas, so this took a long time. Josie found it hard, but I liked seeing the elephants eat. We also washed the elephants in the river with big brushes and soap. I had a lot of fun, even if I got wet!

In the evening, we took the elephants to the forest where they slept. All the volunteers stayed in the same house. Josie and I shared a small bedroom. It was hot at night, but we were ready for that. The food was very good, and we did not eat meat, which we don’t like.

After dinner, we talked and played games. Now that we are back in the UK, Josie does not talk much about Thailand. But if someone asks her if she liked it, she says yes. I think she is a little sad because she missed her friends. But when she thinks about it, she knows she was lucky to go there. Maybe she will go back one day. I want to go back!"

Text: "My name is Gina D’Costa. I have a flower shop in the UK. I sell flowers to many people. Some people buy flowers for friends or their homes. Hotels and offices also buy flowers. Sometimes, I help businesses by providing flowers for their pictures. Once, I decorated a castle with flowers for a wedding. It was a lot of work, but I was very proud.

My day starts at 4 a.m. I go to the market to buy fresh flowers. Most people are still sleeping. My friends think I am crazy, but I love my job. It is often cold and dark, but I do not mind. The flower market is beautiful, with flowers from many places. It is hard to choose flowers. My favorite color is pink, so I would choose pink flowers for myself. But I have to remember that other people want different flowers. Not all flowers are available all year.

I do not like to argue about prices with the flower sellers, but I have to do it. Flowers can be expensive, so I try to get the best price. At my shop, we look at customer orders and prepare vases with the flowers. Then, we make bunches of flowers and check the prices. Sometimes, customers are surprised by the prices, and I ask them to think again about what they want. Some people think this is too much work, but I enjoy making nice flower arrangements for the money people want to spend. I love my job!"

Text: "My city has a modern cinema. It shows new films and kids' films on weekends. The cinema is close to my home. A year ago, I wanted to talk about films with friends after watching them. So, I started a film club with two friends! We do not rent a cinema. Each month, we choose a different place in the city. For example, we used an old factory to show a film about Antarctica. It was very cold, and it was perfect for the film! Some places are free because the owners sell snacks. This helps us keep our prices low. We just want to cover our costs, not make money. Each time we show a film, it gets easier for us. We have our own equipment now. We can see how many tickets we sell online, so we do not worry about empty seats. There is always a lot to do, but when people say they had a great time, it makes us happy. Our website helps us connect with other film clubs in the country. We visit them to see how they do things, but we love our own club! We started a blog because many people look for film information online. We also put up posters in cafés. But the best way to get people to come is when friends tell each other about us. The audience enjoys the fun activities we have with each film. Last month, we had a movie quiz, and everyone liked it!"

Text: "When I was a child, I loved taking photographs. When I was 15 years old, I wanted to do something special with my hobby. I decided to take one photo every day for a year. Many young photographers did this before, but I thought it was a great idea. After a few weeks, I put my photos on a website for young photographers. I wanted to make a photo diary and show my photos to others. I was happy to see that people liked my photos. I enjoyed taking pictures of many things. Then, someone told me to take photos of one topic. I agreed and started to take photos of nature, especially birds and the sky. Many of my photos were black and white, which was different from other photographers who took color photos. Sometimes, I felt unsure about my project and almost gave up. But in the end, I believed in myself and became more confident. One day, I showed my project to my art teacher. She told me about a photography competition for young people. I entered some of my photos for fun. I was so happy when I won first prize! This made me realize that my photography was good, and I could be a professional photographer. Now, I have my own photography studio, and I am happy with my choice."

Text: "I joined the National Youth Challenge (NYC) last year. I wanted to go camping and sailing. I also wanted to learn new skills like public speaking. In the NYC, you can do many activities. You can challenge yourself and learn something new. There are different levels, from beginner to advanced. Adult volunteers, called ‘leaders’, help us. When you finish each level, you get a certificate.

When I first joined, my leader said I should help at a local children’s club for two hours a week. I was not sure about this. I had joined that club when I was eight, but I found it hard to make friends. I was shy, and the other children had their own friends. I stopped going after a few weeks. But I decided to try this challenge because I wanted my first NYC certificate.

Soon, I wanted to spend more time at the children’s club. It was more important to me than just getting the certificate. When I finished the challenge, the NYC leader let me keep volunteering at the club. I made good friends with the children. Now, I go there for about four hours a week, and I look forward to it.

Because of what I learned at the children’s club, I want to go to college after school. I want to be a youth worker, someone who works with children. I never thought about this before. This has been my favorite part of the NYC, and I have improved my communication skills while helping others. I have several NYC certificates now, and one of them is for camping!"

Text: "I was born in Denver, USA. I started snowboarding when I was eight years old. My dad took me to the mountains, two hours from Denver. The hill was very steep. My dad had to convince me to try snowboarding. I did not think to ask him if I could start. He loved snowboarding and wanted me to love it too. He made it look easy. In the end, I did well. I loved snowboarding and got better. I started to compete when I was ten years old. Some people get bored of competitions, but I still love to compete and win. I enjoy not having a strict plan. One time, I got a perfect score at a local competition. I was surprised I could do it. This made me trust myself more. 

In the summer, I train and study because there is no snow. I train every day, but I do not have to follow a strict diet like in winter. I spend time with my friends. This helps me feel better when I cannot snowboard. I think about my future. Snowboarding is very important to me, but I want to have another job too. I am thinking about becoming a doctor if I have time for college. I cannot imagine getting tired of snowboarding, but I know I cannot snowboard forever."

Text: "When I was fifteen, I wanted what my friends had. I did not think about the future. One day, my best friend got a new phone for her birthday. I wanted a new phone too. My parents said I could have one if I paid for it myself. So, I decided to work part-time and save money. I am thankful to my parents for this. It taught me a good lesson.

I worked every Saturday in a café, but I did not like it much. My parents suggested I start my own small business. I saw my mum making necklaces, so I asked if I could try. I thought it would be hard, but it was easy. My friends thought it was boring, but I liked it. My mum showed me how to make pretty things at home.

I sold my first jewellery to my friends and family. They said they liked it, but I was not sure. I wanted to see if other people liked it too. So, I rented a market stall with my mum. Many tourists came to buy my things. They wanted to give them to their family and friends. Soon, people from all over the country called us to buy more. They thought we were a big company, but it was just me and my mum!

That was when I knew my business could work. I decided to make a website. Since then, I have made a lot of money from my business, mostly online, but we still have our stall. It has been a lot of fun!"

Text: 

Janine Stuart is a young writer. When she was 13 years old, she wrote a book called Being Amelia. This book became very popular. Being Amelia is about a girl named Amelia. Janine said that her family moved a lot because of her father’s job. This helped her understand how it feels to be the new student in school. 

In her book, Amelia has funny moments at home, especially with her older brother. Janine does not have a brother, so she used her imagination to write about this. 

One summer, Janine was bored at home, so she started to write her novel. Her mother wanted to be a writer too, and her teachers told her to write. The year before, Janine won a prize for a short story she wrote. This is why a publishing company wanted to read Being Amelia. They liked it, and a year later, the book was in stores. 

A review of Being Amelia says that even though the cover shows happy teenagers, the characters face some hard times. This makes the story real for readers. The reviewer thinks Janine is a very good writer, even if she is young. 

Now, Janine is getting used to being a famous writer. At first, she felt shy when people recognized her, but now it is OK. She wants to help other young writers, but she says they need to find their own way. For her, spending time with friends helps her find ideas to write about.

Text: "My name is Tom. I am fifteen years old. Three years ago, my family and I moved to a castle on a small island. My father got a job as the manager of the castle. He works for a group that takes care of old buildings. At first, we were not sure about moving. We thought life on the island would be different. The castle is not as comfortable as our old home, and there is no school on the island.

After we moved, we got used to living on the island. The castle is not very beautiful, but our apartment is nice. In summer, many visitors come to the island, and there are parties on the beach. In winter, we see only a few other families. There are not many teenagers, which is sad for me. The adults help each other with work on the island.

The biggest change for me is taking a boat to my old school every day. I like going on stormy days when there are big waves, but the ferries do not run then. If I miss the bus to the boat, I miss the last ferry home, and that makes me worried. When my friends come to visit, I tell them to hurry!

Sometimes, we see beautiful views, like when the sun sets over the sea. Other days, it is very foggy, and we cannot see anything. But then, the sun comes out again, and it is amazing! We do have strong storms, and I wonder if the castle is safe. But I remember it has been here for many years, and it is still standing!"

I live in a house in the countryside in Scotland. I love nature and animals. Six years ago, I started a new hobby – birdwatching! I went to the mountains in northern Scotland with my family. We saw many birds in nature. I watched them with my parents. They taught me how to see different types of birds and where to find them. It was amazing! After that, I joined a birdwatching club for young people. My goal is to see 200 different types of birds. I am close to this goal because I have seen birds in other countries, too.

I learned that you need to be patient with birdwatching. I made a video about this and many teenagers liked it. My teachers asked me to talk about birdwatching at school. Text: "I started playing football when I was 7 years old. I would hurry home from school to play with other kids. I loved it, and I got better at it. My family thought I would stop playing like I did with other hobbies, but I didn’t. I wanted to play football professionally when I grew up.

Text: 

In the UK and other countries, schools and universities want students to start doing research early in their studies. Research is not just for famous scholars or scientists. It is a way to learn and build skills. Research skills are important for studying and for jobs because they help you think about the world and your work.

As a student, you can help create knowledge. You do not just repeat what you learn; you ask questions. You might ask: Why? How? When? What does this mean? These questions are part of research. 

Research can be simple or very complex. Simple research can be asking questions about everyday things. You have already done some research in your life. For example, you may have asked questions for school projects or when you wanted to know how to do something, like fixing things at home or planning a holiday.

In college and university, you are expected to ask questions, think critically, and explore information. Some students may find this hard because in some cultures, knowledge is seen as fixed. They may think it is wrong to question teachers or books. However, in many places like the UK and US, it is okay to question what you learn.

Critical thinking is very important in research. You should not just accept everything you read as true. You need to think about it, test it, and see if it makes sense. It is important to not just believe everything you are told but to think for yourself.

Text: 

Cities are important places for ideas and creativity. In the past, people met in coffee houses in London to talk about science and politics. Today, in Paris, artists like Pablo Picasso discuss modern art in cafés. But living in a city can be hard. The same cafés that helped people talk also spread diseases like cholera. Picasso eventually moved to the countryside.

Cities can be very busy and stressful. Scientists are studying how living in a city affects our brains. They found that city life can make us tired and can make it hard to think clearly. One reason is that cities do not have enough nature. For example, patients in hospitals get better faster when they can see trees from their windows. Even a little bit of nature can help our brains feel better.

More people now live in cities than in the countryside. This means we are often surrounded by many people and buildings. Living in a busy city can affect our mental and physical health. When we walk in a busy street, our brains have to pay attention to many things, like other people and cars. This can make us feel tired because our brains are always working hard.

Natural places are easier for our brains. They help us relax and feel better. This idea is called attention restoration theory. A psychologist named Stephen Kaplan first talked about it. He said that being in nature can help our brains recover. Nature has things that catch our attention without making us feel bad, unlike loud noises like police sirens.

Before scientists studied this, philosophers and city planners were already worried about city life. They wanted to bring more nature into cities. Parks, like Central Park in New York, give people a break from city life. Spending time in a park can help our brains work better quickly. 

Many people look for ways to feel better and think better, but walking in nature is one of the best ways. Even with all the problems of city life, cities keep growing. Research shows that crowded cities can also be places of new ideas and creativity. The many people in cities help create new things, just like in 18th-century London. 

The challenge is to find ways to make city life better for our minds while keeping the good things about cities. Sometimes, people feel tired of nature and want to go back to the city!

For example, in archaeology, we see that tools, decorations, and writing help people think and grow. So, what is outside our heads can also be part of our mind. This shows us that human intelligence can change and grow with new tools. The mind is always changing. The stick, or any tool, helps us learn and understand our environment. For humans, tools help us satisfy our curiosity. This is why we make things, and these things help shape our minds. I call this metaplasticity – our minds can change as we use different objects.

I want to show that material things are important for understanding the mind. MET helps us see how tools, from simple stones to smartphones, help define who we are and how we think. Technology can change our minds, and humans have used it since the beginning.

Text: 

Photography is an important invention. It has changed how we see the world. In the United States, photography became a big part of culture. It is used in many ways: for science, industry, art, and fun. Historians say photography is one of the best contributions to art in the US.

Photography started in the mid-19th century. People liked it because it used machines, and many people were excited about new technology. Just like trains and electricity made travel easier, photography brought images of the world into homes. 

The camera helps people show who they are. It allows families to keep memories, even if they are not always real. Photographs show everyday life and are a way to share what we see. A photograph is a record of what was in front of the camera. 

However, every photograph also shows the photographer's point of view. We might think we understand a photo because we know what it shows, but the meaning can be more complicated. The way we see a photo can change based on where we see it, like in a newspaper or a gallery.

For many years, artists did not talk about how important the camera was. But now, artists use photographs in their work. For example, Andy Warhol used photographs in his art. Today, photography is an important part of art and helps us understand representation.

In 1890, William James was an American thinker and doctor. He helped start modern psychology. He said psychology is the "science of mental life." This means it studies how we think and feel. Everyone has thoughts and feelings, so we can understand this idea a little.

William James was very interested in how people think. He believed that our minds have basic parts: thoughts, feelings, and the world around us. We learn about these things from our own experiences. Sometimes, our opinions about why people act a certain way can be wrong. For example, we might think someone is sad or angry without knowing the real reason.

Psychologists try to find the best answers to questions about how we think and act. They help us understand the difference between our personal thoughts and scientific facts. Psychology studies the mind and brain, but we do not know everything about how the brain works. Psychologists learn more by watching how people behave.

Studying psychology is like solving a puzzle. Psychologists look for clues in people's behavior. They must observe carefully and measure things accurately. Psychology aims to describe, understand, predict, and change how we think and act. This knowledge can help us in many areas, like teaching children or helping people with their feelings.

Psychology has been studied for a long time, but only scientifically for about 150 years. Early psychologists looked at their own thoughts to find answers. This method has some limits. Today, psychologists prefer to watch how people behave instead of just thinking about their own experiences.

Psychologist Gabriele Oettingen studied this idea. She found that thinking too much about good outcomes can make people less motivated to work hard. For example, people who imagined having a great week at work did not do as well as they hoped.

Another psychologist, Carol Dweck, studied how people feel about failure. She says some people think ability is something you are born with. They feel bad when they fail. Other people believe ability can grow with effort and practice. They see failure as a way to learn and improve. Dweck compares this to weight training: muscles get stronger when they are pushed to their limits. 

In summary, having a positive view can be good, but it is also important to learn from failure.

Text: 

"The more I practice, the luckier I get," said golfer Gary Player a long time ago. This saying is famous in sports. Many athletes and their coaches believe it. 

People argue about who first said this. Some think other golfers said it too. The meaning of the saying is not clear. Player did not mean "lucky" in a real way. He meant, "The more I practice, the better I get." 

This saying connects to a big question: Is talent something you are born with, or can you learn it? Many people believe that practice is more important than talent. Psychologist Anders Ericsson said that to be an expert in something, you need to practice for 10,000 hours. His idea is in many books, like Malcolm Gladwell’s Outliers. These books say that practice is the most important thing to become good at something.

But author Epstein thinks differently. He says that looking only at the best people does not help us understand why some people are good and others are not. He travels around the world to find answers. He learns that in a tough dog race in Alaska, the dogs' desire to win is very important. This shows that some abilities might come from genes, not just practice.

Epstein talks about "hardware" (nature) and "software" (nurture). He believes both are important for top athletes. He thinks that if Usain Bolt had grown up in the US, he might have played basketball instead of being the fastest man in the world. 

Epstein also asks important questions about race and gender in sports. He wonders why we have separate competitions for men and women if practice is the only thing that matters. Sometimes, the best questions are the simplest ones.

Text: 

Humans live mostly in the light of the sun. We are used to being awake during the day. Our eyes are made for sunlight. But we have changed the night by adding a lot of artificial light. This is called light pollution. 

Light pollution happens when lights shine up into the sky instead of down where we need them. This bright light can change how animals live. Many animals, like birds, need darkness to sleep, find food, and have babies. 

A long time ago, in 1800, people in London used candles and lanterns. There were not many lights in the streets. The night was dark, and people could see the stars. Now, we have many bright lights, and we cannot see the stars as well. 

Light is very strong and can attract animals. Birds can fly towards bright lights and get lost. Some birds sing at night because of the lights. 

We need darkness to be healthy. If we do not have darkness, our bodies do not work well. Our sleep and wake times are important for our health. 

In the end, light pollution makes us forget about the night sky and our place in the universe. We lose the beauty of the stars and the natural rhythms of day and night.

Text: 

I bought my first metal detector after I got married. It cost £70, which was a lot of money then. My wife, Marion, was very happy when I found a gold ring worth £80 on my first trip. Over the years, I found many things like brooches and coins. I liked feeling connected to the past. 

After the gold ring, it took 40 years to find something that impressed Marion again. One rainy February afternoon, I had some time to search. I went to a place where I knew there were old farming tools. My detector beeped, and I found a piece of a metal wheel. Then it beeped again. I dug down into the mud and found a round, golden ball. I was excited but tried not to get my hopes up. 

As I cleaned it, I saw it was a beautiful loop. I remembered seeing something like it in the British Museum. It was called a torc, a special necklace from over 2,000 years ago. I took it to my car and looked at it on the way home. I showed it to Marion when I got back. She was surprised and asked what it was. I told her it was a very old and rare piece of jewelry. 

We didn’t try it on because we didn’t want to break it. At night, I hid it in our wardrobe. I was worried about it being stolen, so I put it under a floorboard in my office. The law says I must tell the authorities about my find within 14 days. I wanted to enjoy the torc before I gave it up. I even took it to show a friend in the hospital. 

Finally, I took it to the council office. The registrar was busy talking to someone when I put the torc on his desk. He stopped talking and looked at it. The torc was confirmed as real and was sold to my local council. Now, it is in the British Museum in London. I got £350,000 from the sale, which I shared with the owner of the field. 

But the torc is more than just money. It is something special for everyone. People ask me if I will stop using my metal detector now. But I still find brooches and coins interesting. Just like a fisherman who catches a big fish, I will keep searching for more treasures.

Text: "Sleeping is one of my favorite things when I travel. I don’t talk about it much because I feel a little bad. My friends like to tell me about their busy trips with many activities, like visiting museums and hiking. I just smile and don’t say much. What would they think if they knew I like to take naps in the afternoon and sleep in nice beds in Italy? Sleeping better is a nice part of traveling. 

When I went to Mexico when I was young, I was surprised that I slept more than 12 hours some days. There were loud birds outside, but I didn’t care. I felt safe and could sleep deeply. Without alarms and worries, I could sleep easily. I think sleeping is part of traveling, not just a break. When we travel, we see and hear new things. When we sleep, we think about these new experiences. 

Sleep is different in every place. People worry about jet lag, but I think it is more about getting used to new places. In Trinidad, for example, people wake up early, feel sleepy in the middle of the day, and then are active in the evening. Even though Trinidad is only one hour ahead of New York, it takes me days to get used to their sleep times. When I finally do, I feel like I belong there.

I remember one afternoon in Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. I had a big lunch with new friends in a nice apartment by the sea. After eating, we all felt sleepy and stopped talking. One by one, my friends went to lie down on hammocks and sofas. I understood why they had so many pillows. I took some pillows too and followed them. I knew about the siesta, but that day I really experienced it. I shared not just sleep, but a part of Dominican life.

Travel sleep is special because I remember it. In a new place, I enjoy the different smells and sounds while I sleep. If traveling slowly means enjoying every moment, then sleeping is a part of that. Maybe I should not feel bad about my love for sleep and tell my friends that sleeping is also an important part of traveling."

Text: 

The woman looked at herself in the mirror. “What do you think? Be honest,” she said. Mia picked up a nice hat. It was medium-sized and had a pretty bow. “I think this one looks best on you,” she said. The woman made a funny face. “But it is boring,” she said. “Many women will wear a hat like that at my daughter’s wedding. This hat will make me special.” She smiled at the small red and black hat on her head. “Yes, I want this one,” she said.

Mia smiled back. She knew the woman would stand out at the wedding. Mia thought about her own daughter, Jen. It was Jen’s thirtieth birthday today. They were having a family party. Mia was happy to see Jen, Dan, and Luke. She was also excited to meet Jen’s friend, Tattie. Mia’s husband, Jeff, was not sure about the name. “What kind of name is that?” he asked. “It’s short for Tatiana,” Mia said. “I think it’s nice.” Jeff thought it was a strange name. He did not like things that were too fancy. He also thought Mia was too polite. 

An hour later, Mia finished work and went home. It took her only forty seconds to get there. Four years ago, when Luke left home, Mia wanted to turn a barn into a shop for her hats. Jeff was not sure. “Do people really want hats?” he asked. Mia knew they did. She listened to her friends who had trouble finding the right hat for special occasions. 

Mia was right. From the first day, after Jen helped her make a website, Mia’s Hats was a success. Women came from far away to try on hats in her shop in Little Pelham. She made it easy for them to find the right hat. She even let them bring their clothes to match with the hats. Now, she also sold handbags and jewelry.

Text: 

Lawrence Okoye is from London. He has moved to Atlanta, USA. He is thinking about his journey in sports. He is very confident but surprised by how far he has come. He was in the Olympic final for discus throwing. Now, he might play American football, even though he has never played it before.

Lawrence is learning about his new position in football. It is surprising that a 21-year-old from London could be chosen for a big American football team. But Lawrence believes in himself. He was offered a place at Oxford University to study law, but he decided to train for discus instead. In just 20 months, he became the fourth-best discus thrower in the world.

Lawrence came to Atlanta to train for discus. He wanted to prepare for the world championships. He thought about American football but only decided to try it when he got to the USA. After arriving, he saw that there were trials for the NFL in Atlanta. He applied to join the trials, even though he had never played before. 

When asked if he was nervous, he said no. He is sure of his abilities. He did well in tests and drills, and this made him stand out as a good player. He felt happy to hear that he was impressive. 

Lawrence knows he has no experience in football, but he believes he has what it takes. He thinks it is about how hard he works. He is not worried about being selected for a team. Some people say he will be chosen, but he is not too concerned. 

He had a tough time in the Olympic final when he came last, but he is okay now. He is proud that he made it to the final. He knows that sports can be difficult. 

In the NFL, players can earn a lot of money. Lawrence has changed from rugby to athletics and now to American football. Some people think he should focus on just one sport. Lawrence understands this but wants to follow his dreams. If football does not work out, he can go back to discus, which he loves. He thinks carefully about his choices.

Text: 

I woke up on a plane. It was morning, and I looked out the window. I saw a lot of brown and green land. It was September, but it was still not cold in Siberia. I could not see any people. There were mountains, rivers, and forests. My neighbor woke up and smiled. “Good morning, Robert,” he said with a Russian accent. His name was Sergei. He was a salesman from Moscow. He was going to sell safety clothes to miners. 

I told him I was going to Magadan, a city in Siberia. I had a one-way ticket because I wanted to ride my bicycle back to England. “But, Robert,” he said, “there is no road from Magadan. You cannot ride a bicycle.” I thought there was a road, but not many people used it. “Alone?” he asked. “No, I will ride with my friend Al,” I said. “Just one friend?” he asked. “Yes, just one,” I nodded. Sergei looked worried and said “Holodna” (cold) while pointing outside. I showed him my warm clothes with my hands. I did not tell him I did not have much money. I bought my clothes at low prices. I was not sure if they were good enough. 

It all started in a classroom in Scotland. The teacher was talking, and the students were tired. I had a question. I wrote a note to my friend Al. “Hi Al, do you want to cycle across the Karakorum Highway this summer? Rob.” I passed the note to Al. He read it and wrote back, “OK.” 

Now, six years later, I was going to meet Al in Siberia. I was a geography teacher. My job was sometimes hard, but it was also fun. I had long holidays to go on adventures. I visited Al twice during these holidays. After our bike ride in Pakistan, Al wanted to cycle around the world. He was taking on big challenges. Sometimes he thought it was too hard, but I admired him. He was having an amazing adventure and facing new challenges every day. He was proving people wrong who said he could not do it. He was doing something that scared him, and it made him feel alive.

**Simplified Text:**

In The Red Bull Air Race, twelve pilots race through tall pylons. The pylons are between 15 and 25 metres high. The pilots fly very fast, up to 370 km per hour. I was invited to try this flying. 

One hour before my flight, I signed two papers. The first paper said I was healthy. The second paper said I had to empty my pockets. Small things can be dangerous when flying. I learned that I must look at the horizon. The pilot would tell me where to look. I also had to promise to relax when flying upside down and enjoy the view.

Half an hour before the flight, I had a safety talk. I was told not to touch anything. When we started to fly, I was nervous. I had to keep calm and focused. If I panicked, it would be bad. 

The pilot, Dario, and I were in a very fast plane called the Zivko Edge 540. The plane took off, and we turned sharply to the right. I felt the air push out of my lungs. I looked at the horizon and tensed my body. For a moment, I felt very heavy. Then we flew straight again. 

We turned left and went down fast. I felt my stomach drop. We flew close to the ground, between two pylons, very fast. I was allowed to fly the plane for two minutes, but my hand was shaking. Dario then did a barrel roll, which is a full turn in the air. I asked him to repeat what he said, but he did another trick called a loop. 

Many people like this kind of flying, but I thought it was too much. At the top of the loop, I heard a voice saying, “Relax, look up.” I looked up and saw fields. The flight was over in 10 minutes. It was easier than what the pilots usually do. When we landed, Dario ate sandwiches, but I could not eat for a long time. That night, I dreamed about flying in loops.

2. What do the pylons look like?
